dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES across the OLD UNIVERSAL LOGO. And then FLAMING TORCH BURNS IT AWAY and we find ourselves in the middle of an angry mob of torch-wielding PEASANTS. Crashi through a dark forest. Heading for a huge CASTLE. A BOLT LIGHTNING STRIKES conductors above the skylight on top of castle. - This entire opening sequence is in BLACK & WHIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF STRANGE EYES suddenly comes alive, peering out through slits in stained bandages. A MAN spins around into a CLOSE-UP, his elegant face is covered in soot, sweat, and taut lines of exhaustion. But eyes sparkle with an incredible intelligence, bordering o madness. This is DOCTOR VICTOR FRANKENSTEIN. He yells one the most famous phrases in film history:

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: He's alive .... He's alive!! ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, lying in a form-fitted iron pod, is a huge ma face covered in bandages. A loud CRASH spins Victor aroun he runs to a window and looks out. Over his shoulder we s the mob charge the front gate with a tree trunk-CRASH! Wo SPLINTERS. But the gate holds. Victor starts to panic, he spins around and comes face-to-face with a DARK FIGURE.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (DARK FIGURE)
dialogues.text: Success!! Victor SCREAMS in fright, then catches himself

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Oh ... Count ... it's just you. The Dark Figure steps forward into the flickering electri light-show. Tall, dark, and incredibly handsome, he reeks evil. This is COUNT VLADISLAUS DRACULA.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I was beginning to lose faith, Victor. He looks our at the screaming mob.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A pity your moment of triumph is being spoiled over a little thing like grave robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A creepy guy in a TOP HAT and undertaker's suit YELLS OUT

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: You know what he's doing in there! To the bodies of your loved ones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor is clearly on the verge of a nervous breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I must ... I must escape this place. Victor dashes across his laboratory; the Industrial Age a its grotesque beginnings. Weird iron generators and enorm copper dynamos line the walls. Huge gears GRIND. Massive belts WHIRL. Electricity ARCS everywhere. Dracula is now up in the rafters, as if magically transported.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Where are you going to run, Victor? SPARKS rain down as Victor throws open a traveling chest wildly begins packing. Dracula is suddenly on the complet opposite side of the room, pacing the mantelpiece.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your peculiar experiments have made you ... unwelcome, in most of the civilized world. Victor looks up at Dracula, momentarily confused by Dracu impossible moves.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I'll take him away, far away, where no one will ever find him. He starts packing again, bur Dracula is suddenly right ne to him. He steps on the lid of the trunk and slams it shu

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No, Victor, the time has come for me to take command of him.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think I brought you here? Gave you this castle? Equipped your lab?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You said you believed in my work.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: And I do. But now that it is, as you yourself said, "a triumph of science over god," it must now serve my purpose.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! goes the tree trunk. Splinters FLY. The gate starts give. The Crowd CHEERS. Thunder ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor's eyes slowly widen in horror, he starts to back a

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Good lord ... I would kill myself before helping in such a task.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Feel free. I don't actually need you anymore, Victor. I just need him ... he is the key. Dracula moves in for the kill. Victor backs away towards roaring fireplace, eyes narrowing in defiance.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Before I would allow him to be used for such evil, I would destroy him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I cannot allow that to happen. My brides would be very put out.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: IGOR! ... Help me! A despicable little hunchback with horrible buck teeth an evil eye stares down from the rafters. This is IGOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been so kind to me. Doctor, so caring and thoughtful (gestures out to the mob) But if they catch me, they'll hang me again. Igor reveals his horribly disfigured broken neck. Victor quickly reaches the mantel and grabs a sabre crossed over Frankenstein family coat-of-arms.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You can't kill me, Victor ... Dracula impales himself on Victor's sabre and keeps walki impaling himself all the way up to the hilt, bringing the men eye-to-eye. Victor is beyond shocked. Dracula smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --- I'm already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! goes the front gate. EXPLODING into splinters. Peasants and torches pour through. LIGHTNING FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula's canines glide out into razor sharp fangs, all t blood drains from his face, his hair turns pure white. Vi SCREAMS. The Count bites down into his neck. Up in the rafters, Igor scurries off through a door, slam it behind him as Victor's SHADOW is murdered above it. Dracula drops Victor's limp body to the floor. And that's when a horrific ANGUISHED BELLOW suddenly fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Nooo! Dracula spins around, dropping Victor to the floor. A dyn hits Dracula full on. He and the dynamo are flung into th fireplace, scattering flaming logs and embers. A bandaged APPARITION scoops Victor into its arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor scurries our a small door outside the castle wall an closes it behind him, then he looks up over the wall to t peasants storming the upper ramparts. He cackles in glee. door behind him suddenly bursts open. The Apparition race out, carrying Victor in its arms. It blows past Igor and heads off across the moors, heading for an old WINDMILL u a bluff. Igor is shocked and panicked, he quickly looks u the peasants and points to the Apparition.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: FRANKENSTEIN! He's created a monster! ! Igor fearfully scurries off into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the ramparts, Top Hat points down SCREAMS:

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: LOOK! It's headed for the windmill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the fireplace, the Count flings the massive dynamo across the laboratory. It hits a generator that bl into a flume of sparks and fire. The Count charges out of fireplace, his face is a burned mess, but it quickly and completely heals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob charges across the moors, chasing the Apparition towards the windmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob charges the windmill. The creature slams the door shut on them, then dashes across the room, which is an ol Absinthe Still. He rampages up a rickety wooden staircase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the windmill, the creature rages through a splintering door and looks down at the crazed mob below. finally get our first good look at FRANKENSTEIN'S MONSTER bolts, scars, stitches, and the back of his head is made glass, a small electrical storm is going off inside it. B the look in his eyes surprises us, he is terrified, this tremendous beast of a man is actually fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula's SHADOW rises up the laboratory walls and TRANSF into something huge, with wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein groans in fear as a thick unbroken band of FLICKERING TORCHES encircles the windmill. The SCREAMING peasants throw their torches. A noose of FLAME leaps up t walls. The Monster ROARS. Then looks off at the castle. O in the distance, the castle's glass skylight bursts as a WINGED SHADOW explodes up out of it. High up in the dark, thunder-racked sky, THREE MORE liquid-like SHADOWS come flying through the roiling purple clouds to join it.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANTS
dialogues.text: Vampires! Run for your lives! The huge crowd flees in horror across the moors. The FLAM have surged up the windmill and now surround Frankenstein Monster. He looks down at Victor and hugs him tightly to chest.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Father ... Then with tears on his cheeks, he lifts a fist towards th oncoming shadows above and lets our an anguished BELLOW. And that's when the entire windmill IMPLODES. Taking the Monster and his creator down with it. The timber and the gears and the fans and all the ironwork plummet downward. huge ball of FIRE and FLAMING DEBRIS flies everywhere. Huge billowing WINGS suddenly fly right over CAMERA, practically WIPING FRAME. They immediately become a CAPE, which wraps around Dracula as he hits the ground running. And then three billowing WHITE WINGS fly over CAMERA, and they wrap around three exorically gorgeous young women. Dracula's BRIDES: ALEERA, VERONA, and MARISHKA. Dracula staggers to a stop and stares in desperation at t flaming wreckage. His Brides are distraught beyond words: they burst into tears, wailing with inhuman shrieks. WE PUSH IN on the FLAMING windmill, belching its last sp then slowly DISSOLVE TO its charred remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BLACK & WHITE ends, the FILM SATURATES, becoming a de blue, and then a huge, powerful BLUR rips past the ruins. sound it makes is incredibly deep, feral, and frightening

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down through MASSIVE TREES onto a small clearing. handsome young MAN is tied to a post, hands above his hea PRINCE VELKAN tenses at the sound of the approaching beas And then all goes quiet. Bushes rustle. Velkan's eyes loo left. A tree creaks. Velkan looks right. A branch sways. Velkan waits for the inevitable. And then, 30 feet up a t a massive WEREWOLF creeps out, clinging horizontally to t bark. Ten feet tall. Fangs. Claws. The works. It hunches, about to lunge. Velkan tenses.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Come on. Dracula unleashed you for a reason. The Werewolf leaps. Velkan's hands rip loose of his bindi He vaults himself up onto the top of the post just as the Werewolf slams into it, just missing him. The Werewolf cl to the post and looks up as Velkan leaps up and grabs a v hanging above the post. BEHIND SOME BUSHES: Several MEN pull a lever. The vine jerks Velkan up off the pole, heading for safety but then he comes to an abrupt stop. The look in his eyes tells us this isn't part of the plan. Behind the bushes the men are struggling with the lever.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGER
dialogues.text: It's stuck! It's stuck! A gorgeous young woman spins around and draws her sword: wears the sexy silk dress of a gypsy Princess, this is AN VALERIOUS. One of the men grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: No! Anna! It will kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ripping free of his grip) That's my brother out there! Out in the clearing, the Werewolf snarls up at Velkan and starts to hunch, about to lunge up at him. Anna charges o of the bushes. The Werewolf sees her. So does Velkan.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Anna! No! Anna raises her sword and keeps on charging. The Werewolf snarls viciously and jumps off the pole, it immediately f through a camouflaged mesh covering the ground. Behind the bushes a man swings an ax and chops the ropes attached to the lever. Out in the clearing, a huge iron CAGE rips up out of the ground around the pole. Anna does a back-flip off the cag it's pulled up into the air. Up on the vine, Velkan draws his silver revolver. The roo the cage springs shut, trapping the Werewolf inside. Velk aims down at the Werewolf, but the cage slams into him on it's way up into the trees. His revolver goes flying. Vel and the cage are rocketed straight up into the huge trees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way up in the trees, the cage slams to a stop. Velkan lea off and lands on a branch. The cage starts crashing back forth, the Werewolf trying to rip its way out. Ropes snap

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: My gun! Find my gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the clearing, Anna desperately looks around, seve men begin firing rifles up into the trees, Anna shoves on them out of her way.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No! Find Velkan's gun! It has to be the silver bullets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another rope snaps. The cage swings widly, now hanging by single rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna spots Velkan's silver revolver on the far side of th clearing. She runs for it. The cage suddenly SLAMS DOWN r in front of her, cutting her off from the gun. The Werewo bursts out of the smashed cage. Anna turns and runs like hell. The Werewolf spots her and gives chase. Anna races through the foliage. The Werewolf's POV gettin closer and closer. Anna runs out of the forest and almost goes over a cliff. She stops herself just short, it's a h mile to the bottom, she spins around and starts to run ba into the foliage, then freezes as she sees trees and bush thrown into the air, the Werewolf getting closer and clos The Werewolf leaps out of the bushes, straight at Anna. A is suddenly shoved out of the way by Velkan. He fires his gun. The Werewolf HOWLS in pain, but manages to chomp int Velkan's shoulder and tackle him OFF THE SCREEN. Anna slams to the ground, then spins around, Velkan and t Werewolf are gone. Only the revolver remains, still smoki Anna leaps up and looks over the edge of the misty cliff. Velkan is nowhere in sight. Anna is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Velkan ... And then she hears something and spins around. It's the Werewolf, lying in the bushes. Anna grabs the gun, levels cocks it, and moves in for the kill. And that's when the Werewolf TRANSFORMS, turning into a dying OLD MAN.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Anna stares down at him, horrified. The Old Man smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I die free from Dracula's awful grip. And then with the last of his energy he grabs Anna's ankl

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But now you must stop him! ... He has a terrible secret ... He has --. he has ... !  10. The Old Man dies. Anna stares down at him, then looks off over the precipice. WE PUSH IN on her tear-streaked face she shuts her eyes. Then PULL BACK as another FACE DISSOL UP over hers. It's a "WANTED POSTER." Wanted for murder i many countries is a MASKED MAN wearing a cloak, a cape, a black, wide-brimmed hat. His name is VAN HELSING. A HAND the poster off the SCREEN and we suddenly find ourselves

dialogues.speaker: PARIS, FRANCE
dialogues.text: The hand belongs to a masked man in a cloak, a cape, anda black, wide-brimmed hat. In the background is the Eiffel Tower, half built. It's quiet. Too quiet. And then we hea blood curdling SCREAM. Van Helsing's eyes don't even flin he calmly crumples the poster, chucks it, and moves off d the foggy cobblestone lane, his cape flowing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN DOWN from NOTRE DAME to a WOMAN'S DEAD BODY lying the cobblestones in a puddle of blood, eyes wide open, looking terrified. Van Helsing steps up and gives the bod the once over, studying the spoor. He picks up a smolderi cigar stub next to the body, dripping with saliva, then h freezes, eyes suddenly on the alert, he spins around and RACK FOCUS to the top of Notre Dame. Way up on the North Tower, a huge, shadowy FIGURE clamber the sheer wall and vanishes over an upper railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing silently steps up into the belfry, which is d and dusty and covered in religious relics. Very Gothic. Moonlight slices through the attic windows as Van Helsing glides past the massive church bell, then he freezes, eve hair and muscle on his body suddenly tense. A long BEAT. And then a gigantic malformed MAN DROPS DOWN three feet i front of him, hanging upside-down from the rafters. He SN viciously. This is MISTER HYDE. Van Helsing gingerly take one step back, then pulls down his mask, revealing his handsome face for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Evening. Hyde's fleshy jowls spew phlegm as he speaks, a burning c clamped between his rotten teeth.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: You're a big one. You'll be hard to digest.  11.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'd hate to be such a nuisance. Hyde flips around and lands on his gnarled feet. Van Hels sizes him up, all nine feet of him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I missed you in London.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: No you didn't. Hyde lifts up his huge arm to show three cauterized BULLE HOLES blown clear through his biceps.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got me good. Hyde starts to circle. Van Helsing does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Doctor Jekyll, you are wanted by the Knights of the Holy Order-

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: It's Mister Hyde now.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: -for the murder of twelve men, six womenвЂ”

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: -Four children, three goats and a rather nasty massacre of poultry. So you're the great Van Helsing. He blows a huge smoke ring at Van Helsing. Van Helsing ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And you are a deranged psychopath. Hyde takes the red-hot cigar out of his mouth and crushes glowing his palm.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: We all have our little problems. Van Helsing's whole mind and body to gear up.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: My superiors would like for me to take you alive, so that they may extricate your better half.  12.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: They would, would they?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Personally, I'd rather just kill you and call it a day. Mister Hyde laughs. Van Helsing doesnвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's make it your decision, shall we? Hyde suddenly LASHES OUT with one of his huge hands, catc Van Helsing across the face, slams him back into a wall. Helsing calmly wipes the blood off his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good, we're in agreement then. In a lightning quick move, Van Helsing draws his revolver and FIRES. Like all of Van Helsing's weapons, they are hi stylized, yet ruthlessly functional. The sound is thunder As the smoke clears, Hyde is nowhere to be seen. Van Hels holsters his guns and moves forward. Mister Hyde suddenly charges out of the darkness. Van Helsing instantly comes with circular BLADES in each hand. He spins around and cu Hyde across the ribs as he passes. Hyde howls in pain and unable to stop his own momentum, crashes straight into th huge church BELL, which GONGS loudly. Hyde grabs his ears

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: The bell! THE BELL!! Van Helsing moves in for the kill. His fingers start pump the spring-loaded blades, which begin to rotate, faster a faster until they're a menacing blur of razor sharp steel Hyde grabs the huge bell, rips it off its moorings and sl it down over Van Helsing, trapping him inside. Hyde chuck And then he hears the blades buzzing away inside. Hyde lo concerned, grabs the bell, and lifts it up. Van Helsing i gone, and there's a big hole carved out of the wooden flo Hyde scowls, then hears the blades buzzing again. He look around. Van Helsing is nowhere in sight, then he looks up Van Helsing is crouched up inside the bell above Hyde's h He swings a blade. Mister Hyde's left arm drops to the fl Cut clean off. The bell crashes to the floor. Van Helsing rolls free. He and Hyde stare at the severed arm, flappin away on the floor.  13.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'll bet that's upsetting. The huge arm TRANSFORMS into the arm of a spindly old man Mister Hyde angrily lunges forward, grabs Van Helsing, an throws him clear up through the top of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing explodes up through a wooden trap door and crashes down hard to the deck. He tries to get up, but he nearly unconscious. Hyde leaps up beside him, picks him u the back of his collar and carries him across the tower.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE
dialogues.text: I think you'll find the view over here rather spectacular. At the edge of the tower, Hyde lifts Van Helsing up face- face.

dialogues.speaker: MISTER HYDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Been a pleasure knowing you. Mister Hyde throws Van Helsing off the top of Notre Dame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Van Helsing plummets towards the cobblestones far belo desperately whips out a grappling hook gun, aims, and fir it upwards. The bolt shoots out, tether trailing behind i It blows right through Hyde's belly and shoots out of his back. TIGHT on the bolt as it slows in mid-air, tether slackeni and then the serrated grappling HOOKS snap out, the tethe goes taut, and the whole thing is jerked back out of FRAM The grappling hooks slam into Mister Hyde's back. The tet goes taut. Van Helsing snaps to a stop at the end of the tether, two feet short of splattering into the cobbleston Hyde is jerked forward, but catches himself on the ledge. Helsing gets to his feet, grabs the tether and yanks it. is jerked over the edge, but a single toe stops him from falling, his lone arm flails, and then with all his might throws himself backwards. READ FASTER: Van Helsing is jerked up off the ground. Hyde stumbles ba and falls off the tear of the tower, he drops down and crashes through the roof of the church. Van Helsing rocke up the side of Notre Dame, heading for the top of the tow  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Hyde swings down across the great church and right into the Rose window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive window at the front and center of Notre Dame explodes as Mister Hyde crashes through it. Van Helsing l on his feet at the top of the tower and looks down. WE FOLLOW Mister Hyde down as he TRANSFORMS into a meek O MAN, who has one deeply disturbing moment to consider his predicament. And then he hits the pavement. Up on the tower, Van Helsing looks genuinely remorseful, body slumps in sadness, he makes the sign-of-the cross.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: God rest your soul. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gendarmes, priests, and local denizens race up to the dea body from every direction. Then they all look up to the t of the North Tower, and are instantly terrified, several them run away in fear.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE
dialogues.text: Van Helsing! ... It's Van Helsing!... Silhouetted against the moon is our hero. The SERGEANT of gendarm raises an angry fist.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Van Helsing you MURDERERRRR ...

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO ROME
dialogues.text: The clock behind St. Peter's Basilica chimes as Van Helsi trots his black stallion across the enormous Piazza San Pierro, lined with Bernini's magnificent colonnades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregorian CHANTING can be heard as Van Helsing strides through the greatest church in all Christendom.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside an ornate confessional, Van Helsing drops to one k

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. Knowing what's coming, Van Helsing grits his teeth. A tin partition door slams open. Through the wooden mesh we see CARDINAL JINETTE, a tough old bird with piercing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: You shattered the Rose window!

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not to split hairs, sir, but it was Mister Hyde who did the shattering.

dialogues.speaker: THIRTEEN
dialogues.text: Thirteenth-century. Over six hundred years old! I wish you a week in hell for that!

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: It would be a nice reprieve.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong, your results are unquestionable, but your methods draw far too much attention. "Wanted posters"? We are not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You think I like being the most wanted man in Europe? Why don't you and the Order do something about it? The Cardinal leans in and lowers his voice conspiratorial

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: You know why, because "we" do not exist.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Then neither do I. Van Helsing gets up to go. The Cardinal pulls a lever. Bo on Van Helsing's door lock shut. The Cardinal leans in, a fire and brimstone.  16.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: When we found you crawling up the steps of this church, half dead, it was clear to all of us that you had been sent to do God's work.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why can't he do it himself?

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: Don't blaspheme! You already lost your memory as a penance for past sins. The Cardinal pulls another lever, a series of gears slide the back wall open, revealing a secret hidden staircase.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you wish to recover it, I suggest you continue to heed the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cardinal and Van Helsing enter an enormous undergroun ARMORY, bustling with action, lots of steam and fire.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: Governments and empires come and go, but we have kept mankind safe since time immemorial. Beneath the giant blast furnaces we see JEWISH RABBIS wor the billows, HINDU PRIESTS stoking the fires, and MUSLIM CLERICS hammering red hot scimitars on anvils.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are the last defense against evil. An evil that the rest of Mankind has no idea even exists. Van Helsing's eyes fill with torment, reliving past momen

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: To you, these monsters are evil beings to be vanquished, but I'm the one left standing there when they die and become the men they once were.  17.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: For you, my good son, this is all a test of faith. That is why you have no idea who you are or where you came from. Van Helsing gives him a look. The Cardinal smiles knowing

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say you met God, and he set you on a task, you would have no fear because you would know that God was with you, but if your memory of meeting God were lost, then every day would be a test of faith. Van Helsing sighs heavily, we see the weariness in his ey the weight of his calling pressing down upon him. The Cardinal snaps his fingers and the LIGHT DIMS. A Rabbi tu on a SLIDE PROJECTOR and starts clicking slides, showing way from Rome to Eastern Europe.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need you to go to the east, to the far side of Romania, an accursed land, terrorized by all sorts of nightmarish creatures. A slide of a handsome GOTHIC PRINCE comes up.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lorded over by a certain Count Dracula. Van Helsing's interest is immediately piqued.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Dracula. Then a slide comes up showing a painting of an old fiftee century NOBLEMAN, his suit of armor covered in holy cross his name emblazoned on silver below it: VALERIOUS THE ELD

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: Four hundred and fifty years ago a Transylvanian knight named Valerious the Elder promised God that his family would never rest, nor enter heaven, until they vanquished Dracula from their land. They have not succeeded, and they are running out of family.  18. Several grainy black-and-white slides of a FAMILY come up burly old KING and young Prince Velkan.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boris Valerio us, King of the Gypsies, he went missing almost one year ago. His son Velkan died just last week.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And the girl? Van Helsing gestures to Anna, riding her horse.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: Princess Anna, the last of the Valerio us. If she is killed, nine generations of her family will never enter the gates of St. Peter. The room FLOODS WITH LIGHT. The Cardinal faces Van Helsin

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For more than four centuries this family has held down our left flank. They gave their lives, we cannot let them slip into purgatory.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: So you're sending me into hell.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE
dialogues.text: In a manner. An old Muslim Cleric steps up and hands something to the Cardinal. The Cardinal holds it up for Van Helsing. It's TORN PIECE OF PAINTED CLOTH encased in a strip of glass.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The old knight left this here four hundred years ago. We don't know its purpose, but he would not have left it lightly. Van Helsing stares at it. Painted on the cloth is PART OF LATIN INSCRIPTION.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In Latin inscription translates as: "In the name of God, open this door."  19. And then a look of confusion washes over Van Helsing's fa In the corner of the cloth is an INSIGNIA in the shape of DRAGON. Van Helsing holds his hand up next to the insigni On Van Helsing's hand is a RING with the exact same DRAGO INSIGNIA. The Cardinal sets his hand on Van Helsing's arm fatherly.

dialogues.speaker: CARDINAL JINETTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think that in Transylvania, you may find the answer you seek. .. . On Van Helsing's look WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing strides through a huge blast of steam. An extremely earnest little Friar scurries up, this is CARL.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There you are. Did you bring him back? Or did you kill him? Van Helsing doesn't even slow down. Carl shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You killed him, didn't you? That's why they get so annoyed. When they ask you to bring someone back, they don't mean as a corpse. Van Helsing scowls under his breath. Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah! Right. You're in a mood. Well, come on, I've got a few things that will put the bit back in your mouth. Van Helsing is suddenly attracted to some swords coming o of a flaming forge. Carl grabs him and pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any idiot can make a sword. A huge, beefy, Buddhist Monk covered in sweat steps out f behind the forge, staring daggers at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, father! Carl grabs some items off a shelf and stuffs them into Va Helsing's arms:  20.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rings of garlic, holy water, a wooden stake, a silver crucifix ... Van Helsing watches some Spanish priests fire a Gatling g

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why can't I use one of those? Carl looks at Van Helsing like he's talking to a child.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You've never gone after vampires before have you?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Vampires, gargoyles, warlocks, they're all the same, best when cooked well.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: They are not all the same. A vampire is nothing like a warlock. My granny could kill a warlock.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Carl, you've never even been out of the abbey, how do you know about vampires?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: That's why they make books. He gestures to a collection of manuscripts by Socrates, Copernicus, Da Vinci, and Galileo, then steps up to a gla OVEN where sticks of dynamite are dripping sweat into via

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's something new. Glycerine 48. Carl sticks his pinky into a vial and then flicks a drop the dynamite sweat against a wall, the drop bursts into a large ball of flame. Several of the startled clergy YELL

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL PRIESTS
dialogues.text: Knock it off, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Sorry! Sorry! (aside to Van Helsing) The air around here is thick with envy.  21. Carl grabs a strange-looking CROSSBOW :and hands it to Va Helsing, it's covered in little iron pumps and copper tub

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my latest invention.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Now this I like.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Gas propelled, capable of catapulting bolts in rapid succession at tremendous velocity. Just pull the trigger and hold on. (he adjusts the sight) I've heard the stories coming out of Transylvania, trust me, you'll need this. A work of certifiable genius.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: If you don't say so yourself. Carl doesn't get sarcasm.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I did say so myself. (earnest, not bragging) I am a veritable cornucopia of talent. Van Helsing picks up a very odd-looking CONTRAPTION.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Did you invent this?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I've been working on that for twelve years. It's compressed magma from Mount Vesuvius with pure alkaline from the Gobi Desert. It's one of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: What's it for?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I have no idea, but I'm sure it will come in handy. Carl scurries on as Van Helsing follows.  22.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Twelve years and you don't know what it does?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. I said I don't know what it's for. What it does is create a light equal to the intensity of the sun.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And this will come in handy how? Carl hefts two huge duffle bags filled with weaponry into Helsing's arms.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I don't know. You could blind your enemies. Charbroil a herd of charging wildebeest. Use your imagination.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: No, Carl, I'm going to use yours, that's why you're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: The hell be damned if I am.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: (points an accusing finger) You cursed. Not very well, but you're a monk, you're not supposed to curse at all.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm still just a friar, I can curse all I want ... damn it.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The Cardinal has ordered you to keep me alive ... He shoves the huge duffle bags into Carl's arms.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... for as long as possible. Van Helsing turns and heads off through the flaming forge Carl, carrying the huge duffle bags, staggers off after h  23.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: But I'm not a field man! A blast of STEAM fills FRAME, and then the CAMERA is sudd flying through CLOUDS ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA rips out of the clouds and dives down between craggy mountain peaks, revealing the strange village of VASERIA nestled in the heart of a creepy valley. The CAME whips down into the village and crests the rooftops, as i lands next to a chimney, three WHITE WINGS drop down arou it and TRANSFORM into familiar gowns. The CAMERA holds on village square below, bustling with activity. Aleera trem with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: (Romanian - subtitled) I am very, very excited about this. Marishka pours.

dialogues.speaker: MARISHKA
dialogues.text: (Romanian - subtitled) Why can't we just let the Werewolf kill her? Verona gives her a condescending look.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Never trust a man to do a woman's job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing hoods, heads down, Van Helsing and Carl move thro the vicious-looking crowd. Carl whispering to Van Helsing

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: ++. SO you can remember everything about your life from the last seven years, but nothing before that?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not now, Carl. Van Helsing's keen eyes are busy casing the locals.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There must be something?  24.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: (dead serious) I remember fighting the Romans at Masada.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: That was in 73 A.D.?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You asked. Carl suddenly notices what Van Helsing has already taken the villagers have been sneaking suspicious glances at th

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? Why is it so important to kill this Dracula anyway?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Because he's the son of the devil.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I mean besides that.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Because if we kill him, anything bitten by him or created by him will also die.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I mean besides that. Van Helsing gives him a look. Top Hat steps up to them.

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: Welcome to Transylvania. All the villagers suddenly have knives, machetes, and pitchforks in their hands, and they're all staring at Van Helsing and Carl. Carl nervously whispers to Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Is it always like this?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Pretty much. A pair of RIDING BOOTS step up onto the well in front of them. It's Anna, she gestures to the two men.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You! Let me see your faces.  25. Under the hat, we see Van Helsing's eyes taking her in.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Because we don't trust strangers.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I don't trust anyone. Top Hat pulls out a measuring tape and starts measuring C

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: Strangers never last long here.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you will now be disarmed.. Several village men move forward. Van Helsing glares at t

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You can try. The men stop in their tracks, their resolve ~ wavering in glare.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You refuse to obey our laws?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The laws of men mean little to me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Fine. (she looks out at the crowd) Kill them. All the villagers raise their weapons and start to close

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'm here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't need any help.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Really?  26. Van Helsing whips the crossbow out from behind his back, bow snaps out aimed right at Anna. Anna reacts and ducks, REVEALING the three brides flying in formation right behi her, coming right at her. The brides are now HUGE, WHITE VICIOUS BATS FROM HELL, we know it's the brides because their faces are very distinc within the composition of the creatures. Van Helsing fires. Three bolts. The brides split up as th bolts whiz past, just missing them. The white spectres sw up over the rooftops and around the Byzantine church spir

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: Nosferatu! ! All hell breaks loose. The bats rocket around the square, ripping doors and shutters off their hinges, blowing tabl and chairs end-over-end, throwing people ass-over-teacups

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Everybody inside! Van Helsing keeps firing, trying to get a bead on them. Aleera swoops down, heading for Anna. Anna sees her comin and leaps off the well, right onto Van Helsing, they cras the ground. Van Helsing looks at Anna sprawled across him

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Normally, I don't like women who throw themselves at me .... Anna is suddenly ripped up off of him by Marishka. Van Helsing bounds up onto the well, leaps out and grabs Anna

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thought you said you didn't need any help. The two of them drop free and hit the ground. Anna lands Van Helsing, her thighs straddling his face. He grabs her rolls her to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay here. She grabs him and rolls him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You stay here. They're trying to kill me.  27. Anna instantly leaps up and runs. Van Helsing gets up to after her, then spots his crossbow through the trampling crowd. Verona and Marishka fly up over the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Marishka, my dear, please kill the stranger.

dialogues.speaker: MARISHKA
dialogues.text: Love to. Van Helsing grabs his crossbow and spins around to see Al and Verona flying through the chaos, tossing peasants out their way, chasing Anna. Van Helsing dashes across the square, he fires again, sending Aleera scattering.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Carl! I'm out! Carl races forward, pulls out a clip and throws it to Van Helsing. Van Helsing catches it just as Marishka swoops i him. Van Helsing dives to the ground in the nick of time. MarishkaвЂ™s clawed feet end up grabbing a cow, she lifts into the air and pitches it through a second-story balcon Van Helsing leaps up, slams the clip home and spins to se Anna racing across the far side of the square, Verona sti on her tail. Van Helsing shoulders the crossbow and fires multiple bolts, rapid fire, tremendous velocity. Dozens o arrows rip into the storefronts all around Verona and Ann Anna leaps over some crates as Verona swoops over her, ju missing her. Verona grabs a running man and lifts him up the air. The man screams in horror. Verona just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Be happy in the knowledge that your blood shall keep me beautiful. Verona bites into his neck. Top Hat cackles at this from behind a rack of coffins. Anna leaps up from behind the crates, dozens of arrows are imbedded everywhere. Anna gi Van Helsing an angry look.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Who are you trying to kill?! The whole square suddenly goes dead quiet. The brides are nowhere in sight. All the villagers are hunkered down, looking around. Van Helsing gives Anna a questioning look She nods upwards.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The sun.  28. Van Helsing sees a sliver of SUN shining through the clou Then he hears a loud SPLASH. He and Anna turn and look at well. They move in on it, weapons drawn. They peer into t well. Above them, the clouds cover the sun. Carl reacts.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Van Helsing! Too late. Aleera rockets up out of the well. Van Helsing blown back as Aleera grabs Anna and flies up into the air Van Helsing leaps up and aims, but he can't get a clear s AnnaвЂ™s boots skim the rooftops. She reaches down with h free hand, withdraws a SWITCHBLADE from an ankle strap, flicks it open and slashes AleeraвЂ™s ankle. Aleera SHRIE with a mouth filled with fangs, then throws Anna into the air. Verona swoops in and grabs her. The blade goes flyin Van Helsing tracks the huge bat with his crossbow, then f a single shot. The lone arrow impales VeronaвЂ™s foot, sh SHRIEKS in pain and rage. Anna drops free, falls onto a rooftop and tumbles down. She manages to grab a gutter fo feet up and dangle precariously. She leaps off the roof, flips through the air, lands upside down on the side of a tree, then jumps the rest of the way to the ground and ru like hell. And that's when Carl sees something.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Van Helsing! Two o'clock! Van Helsing pivots in time to see Marishka coming right a him. He fires. A half dozen bolts peg into Marishka. She spirals wildly across the square and crashes straight thr the side of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sprints into a house, slams the door shut, bolts it tight and turns to go. Aleera's face is right in front of her, dangling upside down from a ceiling beam, she licks bleeding ankle and smiles coquettishly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Do you know how long I have wanted to kill you? Anna is clearly afraid, but trying to hide it as she slow backs away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Aleera, did I do something to you in a past life?  29. Aleera flips off the beam and lands between Anna and the door. Anna backs away into the living room as Aleera clos in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Don't play coy with me, Princess, you're just like all the other pretty little ancestors in your family. Saying you want to destroy my master, but I know what lurks in your lusting heart.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I hope you have a heart, Aleera, because someday I'm going to drive a stake through it. Aleera throws a casual UPPERCUT, launching Anna like a ra doll through a closed window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna crashes through the shattering window, lands catlike the ground, and launches herself down an adjacent alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Carl creep towards the building that Mari crashed though. From inside they can hear sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: MARISHKA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My face, look what you've done to my face ... Van Helsing slowly moves towards the building, crossbow shouldered. The front door suddenly blows open. Marishka blasts out and BACKHANDS Van Helsing fifty feet through t air. His crossbow goes flying. Marishka wings around the square, arrows imbedded in her chest and face. Carl dives out of her way as she rips the arrows our, one by one, then lands on a balcony and TRANSFORMS back into a beautiful girl. Van Helsing rolls in time to see Marishka's wounds COMPLETELY HEAL. Carl le up.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: This should do the trick! Van Helsing looks at him. Carl throws a familiar steel an glass bottle.  30.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy water! The bottle flips through the air, Verona suddenly swoops and snatches it. She throws it into the well and looks at Marishka.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Finish him. Then she flies off. Marishka looks at Van Helsing and smi

dialogues.speaker: MARISHKA
dialogues.text: Too bad. So sad. Van Helsing looks over at THE CHURCH. WE CRASH ZOOM acros the square to a TIGHT SHOT of a basin of Holy Water. Then WHIP PAN onto Marishka, she looks from the Holy Water to Helsing. His eyes. Her eyes. Both of them are gearing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna careens into a pub and skids to a stop. Aleera is casually sipping a glass of very red wine. A man lies dea across the bar next to her. Anna spins around, but Verona now right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Hello, Anna, my dear. She starts to move in for the kill. Anna stumbles back in wall, cornered.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You won't have me, Verona. Verona just smiles pleasantly and licks her lips.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: The last of the Valerious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing looks at his crossbow, half way between him a Marishka. Marishka leaps up onto the balcony railing, her arms out, ready to take flight, daring him to make the fi move. Van Helsing goes for it. Racing for the crossbow. Marishka leaps out and TRANSFORMS into a huge bat. Van Helsing dives and rolls as Marishka swoops over him. Van Helsing leaps up with his crossbow.  31.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PUB DAY
dialogues.text: Verona opens her mouth, her canines distend into horrible fangs. Anna throws a punch. Verona grabs her hand, lightn quick, and forces Anna to her knees. Aleera steps up.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: I want first bite. Verona nods her consent. Aleera bends down for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing runs like hell for the church. Marishka plung down into the square, laughing wildly. Van Helsing makes to the basin and slams the tips of his arrows into the wa Marishka rockets right at his back, claws and fangs exten Van Helsing spins and FIRES. Bolts from the crossbow stra into the rocketing bat, only this time Marishka SHRIEKS horribly, accompanied by the sound of sizzling flesh. She spirals up and SLAMS into the middle of the church spire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verona and Aleera both SCREAM. Anna is blown across the p by a shock wave of wind as the brides become bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing pivots as the two spectres crash up through a rooftop and fly into the air, he aims to fire, but they quickly fly off, WAILING insanely. Van Helsing steps back from the church and looks up. The dying bat is pinned to the spire by the arrows in it' chest. The crowd goes quiet, staring up as the hellish th slowly TRANSFORMS back into a gorgeous young girl. Marish glares down at Van Helsing and hisses, then DECAYS into molten rot, shrieking all the way. Carl looks over and notices the cow, standing on the seco floor balcony, looking confused. As the villagers crawl out from under all the wreckage, s of them start pointing accusing fingers at Van Helsing

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: He killed a bride. He killed Marishka! He killed a vampire! Now Carl is confused.  32.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Isn't that a good thing? Top Hat steps up with an amused smile.

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: The vampires only kill what they need to survive, one or two people a month. Now they will kill for revenge. The angry villagers move in with their pitchforks and machetes. Carl looks back at Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Are you always this popular?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Pretty much. Top Hat smiles politely and tips his hat at Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: And what name, my good sir, do I put on your gravestone? And that's when Anna steps up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: His name is Van Helsing. A MURMUR washes over the Transylvanian crowd, but unlike the French, it is in admiration, not fear.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: Van Helsing... It's Van Helsing... Anna gives Van Helsing a nod.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Your reputation precedes you. Van Helsing gives her a hard look back.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Next time, stay close, you're no good to me dead. Anna is momentarily ruffled by this, then she laughs.  33.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Well, I'll say this for you, you've got courage. (she turns to the crowd) He's the first one to killa vampire in over a hundred years! She gives the handsome rogue an appraising look.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd say that's earned him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a DRAGON INSIGNIA, like the one on Van Helsing's ring. Carved into an open COFFIN covered in snow and ice. snow and ice suddenly melt into STEAM as Dracula rises up of it.

dialogues.speaker: MARISHKAAA-
dialogues.text: We are deep in the bowels of a thirteenth-century fortres It's like nothing we've ever seen before. Everything is covered in a thick permafrost. Great icicles hang down fr the ceiling. Icy stalagmites rise up from the floor. With weird, feral movements, Dracula jerks himself out of coffin and walks up an enormous pillar. As he passes anci candelabras, the candles mysteriously ignite.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If it's not the Christians, it's the Moors! Why can't they just leave us alone. We never kill more than our fill. And less than our share. Can they say the same? Dracula walks UPSIDE DOWN across the forty-foot-high ceil

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I not say how important it was to finish with these Valerious. He comes face-to-face with Verona and Aleera, hanging fro beam by their feet, cradled in each others arms, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now that we are so very close to fulfilling our dream?  34. The brides wail in anguish, Dracula's demeanor changes on dime, from anger to sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There, there, my lovelies. Do not worry, I shall find another bride. The brides are appalled.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Do we mean so little to you!?

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Have you no heart!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No! I have no heart. I feel no love. Nor fear, nor joy, nor sorrow. I am hollow! Soulless! At war with the world and every living soul in it! ... But soon ... very soon, the final battle will begin. His demeanor changes on a dime again, he smiles curiously

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I must find out who our new visitor is. Dracula jumps the forty feet to the ground with ease. The huge SHADOW of a Werewolf prowls across the wall behind h a chain around its neck. Dracula smiles at it.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll have to make a special aperitif out of him. We are much too close to success to be interrupted now. Both brides immediately panic and leap off their perch, d the forty feet and land next to Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: No, my lord! Please! Say you won't try again!

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: My heart could not bear the sorrow if we fail again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brides cower in fear. Dracula is immediately horrifie as if he hurt a little child, he envelops them in his cap

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Do not fear me, you must not fear me, everyone else fears me. The brides calm down and begin to purr in his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But we must try ... we have no choice but to try .... For our own survival. Dracula inhales, smelling his brides, but his reverie is broken by the roar of the Werewolf. Behind them, the werewolf's shadow is being poked by a long stick held by HUNCHBACK'S SHADOW; the poking is accompanied by the soun electric shocks.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Igor! The creepy hunchback himself scurries up, slipping across ice, carrying a ten-foot-long electric cattle prod.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Yes, Master!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Why do you torment that thing so?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: It's what I do.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Remember Igor, "Do unto others."

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Yes, Master, before they do unto me.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Now go. Dracula looks up into the rafters.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All of you!  36. A large gang of vile little DWERGI are perched along the beams. German Gothic trolls, short and squat, with weird masks and goggles that completely hide their faces.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To Castle Frankenstein!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge door is thrown open, revealing the Valerious ARMOR Four centuries' worth of nasty weaponry in cases and rack Anna charges in, a woman on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So how did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: We came across the Sea.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Really? The sea? The Adriatic Sea? Van Helsing is all business.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Where do I find Dracula?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He used to live in this very house, four centuries ago, no one knows where he lives now. She gestures to a huge oil PAINTING covering an entire wa a rich and fantastical MAP OF TRANSYLVANIA.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My father would stare at that for hours looking for Dracula's lair. Anna grabs a sword, an iron mace, and some throwing stars

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that's why you've come?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I can help you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No one can help me.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I can try.  37.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You can die trying. All of my family has. I can handle this myself.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: (wry sarcasm) So I noticed. Anna spins on him, angry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: The vampires attacked in daylight, they never do that. I was unprepared. It won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why did they attack in daylight?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Clearly they wanted to catch me off guard. They seem almost desperate to finish off my family.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why is that? Why now?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You ask a lot of questions.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Usually I ask only two, what are we dealing with, and how do I kill it? Anna straps on a metal chest plate and spiked gauntlets.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: My father spent most of his life looking for answers, year after year, (gestures out the window) tearing apart that tower, combing through the family archives. On that, Van Helsing looks at Carl, admiring the weaponry

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The tower. Start there.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Right. Van Helsing keeps staring at Carl. Carl looks confused.  38.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now? Van Helsing doesn't even bother to respond. Carl quickly heads out.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right. The tower. Now. Anna grabs a scabbard, straps it on and heads for the swo Van Helsing blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The only way to save your family is to stay alive until Dracula is killed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And who will kill him if not me? Who will show courage, if not me?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: If you go out there alone, you'll be outmanned and out-positioned. (gestures out a dark window) And you can't see in the dark. Anna laughs this off and moves forward. Van Helsing close the gap between them, inches from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the morning, we'll hunt him together. Anna stares up into his dark eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Some say you're a murderer, Mister Van Helsing, others say you're a holy man, which is it?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: A bit of both, I think. A slight smile creases Anna's beautiful face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I promised you a drink. The bar is down the hall, help yourself. As for me ... (her eyes go dark) I'm going.  39. Anna grabs a sword and slams it into her scabbard. Van Helsing watches her.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you have to carry this burden.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: On the contrary, I would wish for it no other way. And she means it. She grabs a vicious-looking helmet, bla on-black with sharp metal flanges. Van Helsing stares at respect for her growing. She turns She slams grabs her her face. grabs her

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry about your father and brother.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I will see them again. to Van Helsing, her convictions rock solid.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We Transylvanians always look on the brighter side of death.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: There's a brighter side of death?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, it's just harder to see. her helmet on and starts to charge out. Van Helsing arm, spins her around and blows a blue powder into Anna falls back into a wall, out cold. Van Helsing in his arms before she falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manor Valerious spikes up into the dark sky, where menaci clouds roil across a FULL MOON. The MUSIC tells us we're building to something very scary.  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is waking up on her bed, her clothes are on, but her armor and weapons have been removed. She suddenly sits up CURSES in ROMANIAN, then leaps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh my god that hurts ... (then she gets angry) That son-of-a-bitch. She leaps out of bed and storms for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the RAIN splattering against the windows and t ominous music, it's quiet, very quiet, as Anna storms dow the hall. Suddenly, something CREAKS. Anna freezes. The s came from behind a door. Anna opens it and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna steps into the armory and angrily looks into the dar

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Van Helsing!? Another CREAK. Coming from somewhere in the cases. Anna i suddenly on the alert, her eyes scan the gloom. She grabs lantern out of a sconce and moves into the racks. Another CREAK. Anna stops and cocks the lantern back, whoever it she's going to let them have it. Then she moves on, and t slowly peaks around a corner. It's just an open window, t wind and rain forcing the shutter to creak against the wa Anna breathes a sigh of relief. Steps over and closes the window, the FULL MOON glows outside. And then she sees WE PAW PRINTS on the floor, her breath hitches. Her eyes fol the paw prints, which vanish out in the middle of the flo HIGH ANGLE POV: A single eerie musical note signals the presence of something evil, looking down on Anna. Anna instantly knows she's in trouble, starts backing away, breathing harder, she grabs a spiked mace. The POV slowly glides across the ceiling, following her. Anna feels the presence, but she doesn't know where it's coming from, she spins around. Nothing's there. She moves quicker now, weaving through the cases of weaponry. Then hears a LOW GROWL and freezes, trapped in the middle of t armory, she cocks her arm back. A long terrifying beat.  4l. And then a single drop of rain drops down onto her cheek. Anna looks straight up. It's a Werewolf Fangs. Claws. Fur Dripping wet. Dangling from a beam above her, staring dow It ROARS. Anna runs like hell, past a window. WE HOLD on window to see dark clouds completely cover the full moon. Anna rounds a corner and slams into someone. She screams starts to swing the mace. VELKAN grabs her arm. Anna is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Velkan! Oh my God! You're alive!

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Quiet, Anna, I only have a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: But Velkan, there's a Werewolf]

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Never mind that! Listen to me! I know Dracula's secret! He has mumblich nowger lochen ... Velkan has lost control of his mouth. And that's when Ann notices that his clothes are torn to shreds. Anna recoils Velkan's body starts to spasm and jerk, he lurches STRAIG UP THE WALL. He desperately forces his head to turn and l out a window. The roiling clouds suddenly clear and reveal the full moo

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anna! RUN! But Anna is frozen in place, staring at her brother, ten up the wall, who now TRANSFORMS into a Werewolf. The fron door bursts open. Van Helsing charges in. Guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Annal!l? The Werewolf looks out over the cases, sees Van Helsing e the room. The Werewolf throws itself through the balcony doors. Shattered glass and rain scatter around Anna as Va Helsing runs up. VAN HELSING (CONTвЂ™D) Are you alright? She's too shocked to answer. He races out onto the balcon and looks down.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf scampers horizontally across the side of the manor. It leaps off, splashes down into the river and hea into the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The armory door crashes open. Van Helsing spins back into room. It's Carl. He sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Why does it smell like wet dog in here? Van Helsing holsters his revolvers and strides for the do

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Werewolf

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Ah! Right. You'll be needing silver bullets then. Carl scrounges around in his frock and pulls out a bandol filled with gleaming SILVER BULLETS. He tosses it to Van Helsing, who catches it and slings it over his shoulder. snaps out of her shock and runs after Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No. Wait! Van Helsing slams the door shut behind him. We hear somet slam onto the opposite side. Anna runs up and struggles w the door, but it's jammed tight. She is not a happy campe

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Van Helsing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing quietly stalks the labyrinthine streets of th village, chambering rounds of silver bullets, on the hunt The only sound is the muffled revelry coming from pubs. Van Helsing suddenly senses something and spins around, g up, scans the darkness, inhales deeply, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Wet dog.  43. A FLASH OF FUR suddenly explodes out of a distant alley, then in a blur of incredible speed, dodges back and forth across the street, from doorway to doorway, getting close and closer, always hidden or one step ahead of Van Helsin gun barrels. It vanishes into an alley twenty feet in fro of him. Van Helsing starts to back away. VAN HELSING (CONTвЂ™D) Who's hunting who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing spins around a corner and slams his back up against a wall, waiting to be followed. Once again it's quiet, too quiet. And then something slams into the wall right next to him. Van Helsing whips his gun up into Top Hat's face. The "something" that hit the wall was a coffi Top Hat smiles down the barrels, then tips his hat.

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: Well look at that, a perfect fit, what a coincidence. He heads into the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see the wolf man hasn't killed you.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he's getting to it. Van Helsing follows, guns up and ready.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't seem too worried about him?

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm no threat to him, and I'm the one who cleans up after him. Top Hat sticks his shovel into a fresh grave. TOP HAT (CONTвЂ™D) If you get my meaning.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Little late to be digging graves, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: TOP HAT
dialogues.text: Never too late to dig graves. Never know when you'll need a fresh one. Van Helsing hears something and turns around, his eyes sc the darkness. Behind him, Top Hat raises his shovel and swings it down at Van Helsing's head. Van Helsing spins around and grabs it just before it smashes into his face. Hat is terrified. Van Helsing is furious. Then Top Hat's swivel just a hair. Van Helsing sees it and ducks. The bl of fur is exploding out of the darkness behind him. Top Hat takes the full impact of the beast and is launche sixty feet down the alley. He's dead even before he and t Werewolf hit the light-post. Van Helsing whirls around. Sees the dazed Werewolf stagge it's feet. Van Helsing's guns come up. He has the creatur his sights. He squeezes the triggers.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! Anna comes out of nowhere and knocks the guns up. They FI Blasting the light on the light-post. The Werewolf hauls- around a corner. Van Helsing charges after it, races arou the corner in time to see the Werewolf dart off into the forest. Anna runs up beside him. Van Helsing rums, grabs by the throat, and pins her to a wall, furious.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why? His grip is so tight she can't breath.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You're ... you're choking me. He loosens his grip only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Give me a reason not to. Anna stares at him, the look in his eyes terrifies her, b she still won't reveal what she knows.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I can't .... If people knew ... Van Helsing stares at her, then he lets her go. Anna grab her throat and sucks air. As his fury abates, Van Helsing looks back at Anna.  45.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: He's not your brother anymore, Anna. Anna looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I guessed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Before or after I stopped you from shooting him?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Before. Now it's Anna's turn to be furious.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And still you tried to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: He's a werewolf He's going to kill people.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He can't help it. It's not his fault!

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I know, but he'll do it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Do you understand forgiveness?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I ask for it often.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: They say Dracula has a cure. If there's a chance I can save my brother, I'm going after it. She starts to storm off. Van Helsing's arm shoots out and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I need to find Dracula.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And I need to find my brother! He gave his life for me! He's the only family I have left! Anna looks at him, tears in her eyes, heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I despise Dracula more than you can ever imagine, he has taken everything from me, leaving me alone in this world. She slumps back against the wall, drained. Van Helsing's softens, an understanding coming to him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: To have memories of those you loved and lost, is perhaps harder than to have no memories at all. He shakes his head with a sigh, then lowers his arm.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right, let's look for your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strangled by a thick mesh of vines and creepers, Castle Frankenstein has somehow grown even more ominous over the last six months. The sky swirls with dense clouds. Lightn flashes. Thunder cracks. But inside, all is dark and quie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little, gloved Dwerger HAND slams a huge switch down. T laboratory sparks to life. Brilliant arcs of electricity shoot up and down the walls. The massive dynamos, generat gears, and fan belts kick in. The Dwergi are feverishly preparing the equipment. A flash of lightning attracts Dracula to the shattered skylight.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Igor! Igor looks down from the skylight, rain lashing his twist little body, heavy wind practically blowing him off his f

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Yes, Master?!  47.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Have you finished?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Yes, all is done! We're coming down to make the final attachments!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Good. The Werewolf glides in through a fissure in me granite wa its eyes fixed on Dracula. Dracula purposefully ignores i

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Werewolves are such a nuisance during their first full moon, so hard to control. The Werewolf TRANSFORMS back into Velkan, bent over in ag Dracula strides majestically past him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I send you on a simple errand, to find out who our new friend is, and you stop for a talk with your sister.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Leave her out of this, Count! She doesn't know your secret, and I am soon to take it to my grave. Dracula steps up to a filthy iron POD, form-fitted for a large human body. Inside the pod is a BURNT CORPSE.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Don't wish for death so quickly. I intend for you to be quite useful.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: I would rather die than help you.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Don't be boring, everyone who says that dies. Dracula unfastens the metal straps holding the corpse in.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides, tonight, after the final stroke of midnight, you'll have no choice but to obey me.  48. He rips the corpse out of the pod and throws it down in f of Velkan.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look familiar? Velkan stares at it, stricken.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Father. Dracula grabs Velkan, lifts him up off his feet and slams into the pod. Igor barks orders at several of the Dwergi they quickly strap Velkan tight to the pod.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: He proved useless. But I'm hoping with Werewolf venom running through your veins, you will be of greater benefit. Dracula grabs a rusty metal SKULLCAP and slams it down on Velkan's head. Wires and electrodes spring from the skull and attach to the dynamos. Velkan struggles to the last.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: I may have failed to kill you, Count, but my sister will not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna are trotting their horses down a sno country lane, eyes scanning the forest and the road.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: For me, this is all personal, it's about family and honor. She looks over at Van Helsing, curious.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you do it? This job of yours, what do you hope to get out of it?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I don't know, maybe some self- realization.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What have you got out of it so far?  49.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: (thinks hard) --. back pains. Anna smiles. Van Helsing smiles back. And that's when the both spot something on the ground. They halt their horses leap off and run to a spot on the road. Anna beats him to her hand lifts up a long coarse hair.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Werewolves only shed before their first full moon. Before the curse has completely consumed them ... They look off into the distance. Castle Frankenstein loom over the countryside lit up by lightning from without and huge arcs of electricity from within. Van Helsing and Ann quickly pull their horses towards a decrepit old barn nex the castle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't understand, the man who lived here was killed a year ago along with a hideous creature he created.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's when your father went missing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just after that. They strap their horses to a post, then step across the s and up to the edge of the barn. Lightning flashes as they look out at the castle past the battered front gate to th spectacular arcs of electricity flashing out of the windo

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Vampires, werewolves, lightning in winter, this truly is a nightmarish place. Anna just stares out at the hideous castle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I've never been to the sea. Van Helsing looks at her, she doesn't return the look, lo in thought, wistful.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll bet it's beautiful.  50. Van Helsing feels for her. Anna starts for the front door Van Helsing grabs her and pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: There are those who go in through the front door ... He gestures as a flash of lightning reveals a dozen corps tangled in the foliage around the front door.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --. and there are those who get to live just a little bit longer. He pulls her off towards the back of the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna creep down a huge Gothic foyer, thei boots quietly splash through brackish water covering the floor. Suddenly, at the far end of the hall, something sm scurries past. Van Helsing lifts his shotgun tight to his shoulder. Anna nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Dwerger.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Dwerger?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: One of Dracula's servants. If you get the chance to kill one, do it, because they'd do worse to you.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Right. Another little Dwerger steps into view. Van Helsing lower his shotgun to hip height. The Dwerger YELLS IN ROMANIAN to someone above him. Anna turns to Van Helsing, stricken

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: They're using my brother for some sort of experiment.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Anna.  51.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (desperate) My brother is still battling the sickness within him. There's still hope. Van Helsing grabs her, hushed:

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Anna! There is no hope for your brother, bur we can still protect others by killing Dracula. She stares at him, filled with fury and desperation and sorrow. Van Helsing's sympathetic eyes pierce into her. Thunder rumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
