dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES as the Dwergi move like monkeys around the equipment. Everything is starting to accelerate. Dyna CRACKLE. Pulleys WHIRL. Electrical arcs FLASH. Dracula tu a flywheel. The pod with Velkan inside it rises up off th floor, heading for the skylight high above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Van Helsing and Anna come around a huge stone column t faces fill with disgust. Hanging from the ceiling, rafter and beams are dozens of gooey white maggot-like COCOONS, about the size of watermelons. DRIPPING SLIME.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You ever see these before? Anna shakes her head, revolted.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What do you think they are? Van Helsing steps up to one and ponders it.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Offspring.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: A man, with three gorgeous women, for four hundreds years?  52. He looks at Anna and cocks an eyebrow. Anna is shocked, s looks out over the cocoons.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Vampires are the walking dead, it only makes sense that their children are born dead. Van Helsing checks out an electric wire sticking into the cocoon, then notices wires sticking out of all the cocoon

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: He must be trying to find a way to bring them to life. All the wires wend their way up the massive stairs and in the flickering laboratory far above.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was told Dracula and his Brides only kill one or two people a month. He snaps open his shotgun and smashes open a box of SHELL TIGHT on the box of shells MARKED: SILVER NITRATE.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If they bring all of these things to life ... He lets the thought finish itself and starts pumping shel into the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula steps up to a huge vat of neon green liquid, he s the hatch shut and dogs it tight.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Let us begin! Igor and the Dwergi lower blast shields over their heads, then clamber up the towering scaffolding to various power stations. The weather is getting ferocious. Gusts of RAIN whip down from the shattered skylight, backlit by blindin LIGHTNING and accompanied by explosive THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing's fingers dig into one of the cocoons. He pul out a handful of the dreadful white goo and flings it to floor. He goes for another handful.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula spins around into a CLOSE UP:

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Throw the switches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOLT OF LIGHTNING STRIKES the conductor above the pod, courses through Velkan's body. Mercifully, we can't hear scream because one of the straps covers his mouth. A flas energy shoots down wires and into the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flash of energy rips down all the electrical wires an starts them jumping like scalded snakes. Van Helsing watc this, then continues digging a hole in the cocoon, his ha suddenly reveals the repulsive little humanoid face of a PYGMY BAT. It has huge, creepy, lidless eyeballs covered veins, a hairy pig snout, mottled greenish skin, and a ga maw filled with rows of tiny, razor-sharp fangs. Even wit it's eyes open it's obviously lifeless. Anna looks sicken Another flash of energy rips down all the electrical wire And that's when the creepy little thing SNAPS TO LIFE and HISSES. Anna SCREAMS. Van Helsing palms her mouth and pul her tight. All the cocoons begin PULSING with some sort o repulsive inner life. High above, Dracula, Verona, and Aleera stride out of the flickering electrical light show and onto a balcony. Van Helsing and Anna quickly back off into the darkness. third flash of energy rips down all the electrical wires. the cocoons begin QUIVERING WILDLY, shocked into animatio The pygmy bat revealed by Van Helsing suddenly EXPLODES o of it's cocoon. It darts up into the rafters. More cocoon explode open, spraying walls and pillars with gooey white slime. The putrid little things fly around the foyer. The CHITTERING becomes deafening. Dracula smiles at his Bride

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: They must feed. Show them how. Dracula shoves Aleera and Verona off the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And beg the devil that this time they stay alive!  54. The two Brides drop through the air and then TRANSFORM in giant bat form. They fly and cavort with their offspring. Dracula points out the windows and YELLS to his spawn:

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must feed! To the village! TO

dialogues.speaker: THE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Van Helsing whirls out into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: This is where I come in.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No! Wait! You can't! All the windows in the foyer suddenly SHATTER as the brid and their winged vermin start to fly through them. And that's when Van Helsing OPENS FIRE. Pumping controlle bursts, the silver nitrate flashing weirdly. Several of t hideous things are hit. They BURST INTO BLACK GOO. Dracula looks down, insanely furious, all he can see is t silhouette of a man in the foyer far below him. Van Helsi slams his shotgun into a holster strapped across his back

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Now that I have your attention. Needless to say, Dracula goes nuts. He screams in rage an leaps off the eighty-foot-high balcony. Van Helsing sprin hell-bent-for-leather back down the foyer. We don't get t see what Dracula has transformed into, but the sound and of his wings is tremendous, creating a huge wind that thr everything around and almost knocks Anna off her feet as leaps our from behind a stone column and races up the staircase, heading for the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Valerious tower bedroom looks like it's been ransacke a librarian. Ancient artifacts, strange relics, and spiri texts are arranged symmetrically around a huge CANOPY BED flicker of lightning illuminates Carl, wide-eyed as he re from an elaborately inscribed SACRED LATIN TEXT.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Well, that's interesting....  55. And then he hears a horrible CHITTERING. Carl runs to a window and looks out. From this distance, it looks like flying monkeys winging their way over the dark countrysid Carl stares in horror, then turns and runs out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the foyer, the sound and fury and wind dissipate. Then WE CUT TO Dracula's POV, a creepy blueish NIGHT-VISI scanning the foyer. Van Helsing is nowhere in sight. WE T a huge WINGED SHADOW across a wall, it transforms into th shadow of a man. Dracula steps into FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I can tell the character of a man by the sound of his heartbeat. He puts his hand to his ear, we can hear the sound of a HEARTBEAT.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Usually when I approach I can almost dance to the beat.... Strange that yours is so steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna withdraws her sabre as she creeps into the laborator The Dwergi are frantically scurrying about. Igor yells ab the cacophony of the machinery and the weather.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: We're losing power! The human is insufficient! Accelerate the generators! Power the dynamos! Anna notices the pod high above the shattered skylight. Another bolt of lightning strikes it. One of Velkan's arm suddenly breaks loose from the straps and flails wildly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Velkan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several men and a comely BARMAID dash out of a pub and jo dozens of other peasants into the square, staring up into storm racked skies at the approaching winged vermin.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: Oh my God. What do we do? What do we do?  56. Carl comes racing around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: RUUUN
dialogues.text: He grabs the Barmaid and yanks her out of frame as the hideous creatures flock down into the square. Everybody r like hell. Some people are ripped up off their feet and carried into the air, others are gang tackled and mauled the creatures. It's like a scene out of The Birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula stalks through the arches. A phosphorescent match suddenly IGNITES at his feet, he looks down. Van Helsing drops out of a ceiling and STABS a wooden stake deep into chest. Dracula looks at the wooden stake in his chest, th at Van Helsing, standing in a shaft of light. Dracula giv him a rather pleasant smile.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Hello, Gabriel. Van Helsing freezes. We've never seen him puzzled before. Dracula calmly grabs the wooden stake in his chest, rips out and casually discards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna creeps across a catwalk, suddenly, she hears the SCR of charging Dwergi, one to the left, one to the right. An clamps her sword between her teeth and leaps out onto a hanging rope. The two Dwergi leap out after her. All thre them climb. The Dwergi getting closer and closer to Anna. of them grabs her boot. Anna grabs her sword and lashes d cutting the rope, both Dwergi plummet down into a vat of boiling green liquid. Igor and the other Dwergi are too busy to have noticed.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: We must not lose the Master's progeny! Anna sockets her sabre and keeps climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying serenely above the scream-filled village, VeronaвЂ hideous fanged mouth smiles adoringly.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: Feed my lovelies! FEED!  57. She lifts up a terrified man, dangling from her hand, the chucks him out over the village. A swarm of pygmy bats sw in like piranha, grabbing him and tearing him apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dawning realization washes over Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You don't remember, do you? Suspicious, Van Helsing backs off into the ancient foyer.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Exactly what should I be remembering? Dracula follows him, like a cat toying with a trapped mou

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You are the great Van Helsing. Trained by monks and mullahs from Tibet to Istanbul. Protected by Rome herself! But like me... (his face darkens) .---ehunted by all others.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The Knights of the Holy Order know all about you, so I guess it's no surprise that you would know about me.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Oh, but it's much more than that, you and I go back a long way, Gabriel. I know why you have such horrible nightmares. The horrific scenes of ancient battles past? Do you know how you received those triangular scars on your back? Van Helsing's eyes narrow, now it's getting really strang

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: --- how do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna runs up to Velkan, who is still strapped into the po She starts unbuckling the belts. Velkan's delirious eyes finally notice her, a sudden clarity fills them, he start shaking his head and shoving her away with his free arm.  58.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Stop, Velkan! Stop it! It's all right. I've come to save you. The CLOCK TOWER behind them begins to CHIME MIDNIGHT. Velkan's hand grabs AnnaвЂ™s mouth and starts to grow coa hair and horrific claws. AnnaвЂ™s eyes practically bug ou her head. She SCREAMS and tries to rip herself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing hears Anna's scream. Dracula just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: So, would you like me to refresh your memory? A few details from your sordid past? Van Helsing rips a crucifix out of his cloak and thrusts at Dracula. Dracula SHRIEKS and angrily swats it away, th calms down, smiling beatifically, as if nothing, had happened.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess that's a conversation for another time. But before you go, let me reintroduce myself (bows majestically) Count Vladislaus Dragulia. Born 1432. Murdered 1462. His bicuspids distend into razor sharp fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third-story window bursts into shards of glass as a wom leaps through it. Two pygmy bats fly out of the window be her and grab her inches before she hits the pavement. Carl and the Barmaid come racing around a corner just as woman is flown up over their heads. Carl lets go of the Barmaid and jumps up to try and save the woman, but she's high and the hideous vermin carry her off. And that's whe Carl hears a scream. He turns and looks. The Barmaid is clinging to a light post six feet off the ground, her legs are being yanked up by a pygmy bat. Carl grabs a chair on the run and swings it into the creature. hideous thing is knocked away. The Barmaid drops into Car arms. The creature quickly recovers and charges back for and the Barmaid. The Barmaid screams. Carl screams.  59. The creature suddenly pulls up two feet short of killing them, the look on its hideous face has gone from blood-lu to panic, it frantically claws at its body and then BURST INTO MOLTEN FLESH ROT. HIGH ABOVE THE SQUARE: all of the pygmy bats BURST INTO MOLTEN FLESH ROT. Several people are dropped to their dea The two flying Brides freak out and start to SHRIEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula spins around at the distant sound of his brides WAILING. Van Helsing uses the moment to leap into a large dumbwaiter and cut the cables with one of his saw blades. Dracula looks back in time to see Van Helsing rocket upwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock CHIMES. Anna SCREAMS. Velkan looks at his hands eyes widening in horror, he gives his sister one last pathetic look, and then TRANSFORMS into the Werewolf. Ann quickly backs away and slams into another body. She screa and spins around. It's Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I think we've overstayed our welcome. The fat gun in his hand FIRES. The tether shoots off acro the castle moat and slams into the top of a huge oak tree hundred yards away. Van Helsing quickly ties his end taut As the clock CHIMES, the Werewolf sits up in front of it. Viciously tearing his way free, he heads for our two hero Van Helsing scoops Anna up off her feet and leaps over th wall just as the Werewolf rips the shotgun off his back. Van Helsing and Anna start to rappel down the tether. The Werewolf slashes it, severing it. Van Helsing and Anna ar suddenly swinging out over the moat and into the dark for The Werewolf glares after them, filled with an incredible fury as the clock hits the final stroke of midnight....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and the Barmaid look around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: What happened?  60.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: They... they just died. The Barmaid wraps her arms around Carl and kisses him of cheek.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: How can I ever repay you? Carl whispers into her ear. The Barmaid looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you can't do that, you're a monk.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm just a friar....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High atop the castle tower, Dracula cradles the sobbing brides in his arms. Igor slithers up, looking terrified, he had a tail, it would be tucked firmly between his legs

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: I am sorry, Master. We try and we try, but I fear we are not so smart as Doctor Frankenstein. Dracula turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Truly. Igor cowers, but Dracula seems spent.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is clear that the good Doctor took the key to life to his grave. The Werewolf steps up onto the parapet, an insane look in it's eyes. Dracula waves him away, dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hunt them down. Kill them both. The Werewolf gives him a deranged look and snarls evilly, clearly he is Velkan Valerio us no more. He turns and lea off the parapet.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN lashes down on Van Helsing and Anna as they stagger across the moors, heading into the ruins of the old windm With the loss of her brother, Anna doesn't know whether t scream or cry, so she does both, and aims it at Van Helsi

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: A wooden stake?! A silver crucifix?! What did you think?! We haven't tried everything before? Anna shoves Van Helsing back under one of the huge charre windmill sails, a refuge from the rain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been hunting this creature for more than four hundred years. We've shot him, stabbed him, clubbed him, sprayed him with holy water and staked him in the heart, and still he lives! Van Helsing just stares at her, fire fascinates him, fier women even more so. She gets right up into his face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you understand?... Nobody knows how to kill Dracula. Their faces are inches apart. RAIN pours down on them. A slight smile creases Van Helsing's lips.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I could've used that information a little earlier. Anna just scowls, breathing hard. Van Helsing's dark eyes stare at her, he likes being this close to her. But she's upset.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Don't give me that look. I don't need your wolf's eyes undressing me... She shoves herself away and stares off into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++. not right now anyway. Van Helsing picks up an undamaged absinthe bottle and adm it. Anna looks at him, the fight going out of her.  62.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were right ... I'm sorry ... he isn't my brother anymore. She steps up closer to him as he uncorks the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have any family, Mister Van Helsing?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I hope to find out someday, that's what keeps me going. Anna takes the bottle and holds it up in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Here's to what keeps you going. She takes a deep slug, clearly it has a bite.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Absinthe. Strong stuff Anna hands him the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes. Don't let it touch your tongue, it'll knock you on your- -And that's when the soggy ground beneath them suddenly C IN. The two of them and a load of timber drop into a rapi expanding breach in the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna and a cascade of water and timber cr down into a cavern and WE FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP: on the Transylvanian village at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is asleep on a couch. He suddenly sits up, terrified then looks down and sees the sleeping Barmaid.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Ah! Yes ... now I remember.  63. Carl leans back against the wall, triggering a secret pan to swing open and reveal a PAINTING: a fantastic mural of medieval KNIGHTS facing each other atop a sea lashed clif There is writing in Latin encircled around the two men. C translates it:

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even a man who is pure in heart, and says his prayers by night, may become a wolf when the wolf-bane blooms, and the moon is shining bright. He steps up to get a closer look and finish the inscripti

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or crave another's blood when the sun goes down, and his body takes to flight. As soon as he finishes the last word, the entire painting COMES ALIVE, trees sway, grass blows, huge waves pound th cliff, the clock on a church tower begins to CHIME, and t two knights TRANSFORM: one into a Werewolf, the other int Winged Beast from Hell. They viciously attack each other. Carl of course freaks out, stumbles back, knocks the enti couch over and lands on the Barmaid's semi-naked body. Sh angrily shoves him off as he looks up at the painting. Th ancient painting is back to being just a painting, as if was all in his mind. He stares at it, perplexed, as his Transylvanian girlfriend angrily gathers her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: Friars, monks, priests, you're all the same!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna slowly wakes up on the dark cavern floor, groggy and sore, she rubs her head and groans. A HAND quickly covers mouth. She looks up. Van Helsing's finger goes to his lip

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Shhh ... there's something down here. And it's carnivorous. He gestures to a massive pile of RAT BONES, picked clean. Anna gets to her feet. The cavern is lit by a very dim gl coming from tiny crevices in the roof.  64. A fetid little stream wends its way through the cavern. V Helsing starts to head downstream. Anna draws her sword a follows.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever's down here appears to be of human ancestry. He gestures to a large set of muddy BOOT PRINTS.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd say he's a size 17. About 360 pounds. 8 1/2 to 9 feet tall. He has a bad gimp in his right leg.... And three copper teeth.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How do you know he has copper teeth?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Because he's standing right behind you. Van Helsing goes for his guns. Frankenstein's Monster lea out of the pitch blackness behind Anna and slams her into Helsing. Our two heroes crash to the floor. Van Helsing's revolver goes flying. The monster is on Van Helsing in a flash he lifts him up his head and hurtles him into a rock wall. Van Helsing bounces off the wall and slams to the floor. The monster looks down at Anna. Anna gets a good look at him. He now looks even more horrific than before, having been badly burned so long ago.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, the Frankenstein monster.

dialogues.speaker: MONSTER
dialogues.text: Frankenstein's VOICE is a horrible, guttural rasp.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is the monster here?!? He lifts Anna up off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have done nothing wrong and yet you and your kind all wish me dead!  65. Van Helsing leaps up and tackles Frankenstein. Frankenste head slams into a rock wall, the top half of his head pop off. Van Helsing grabs him by the neck, the bolts SPARK, Helsing is shocked back against the far wall, he crashes the floor, trying not to pass out from the pain. Frankenstein slams the top of his head back into place, t the top half of his body turns around and he heads for An Anna backs away, up against some burnt timber, looking around, playing for time.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What do you want? Frankenstein stares down at her, his face growing mournfu

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: To exist. Van Helsing yanks an ivory BLOWGUN out from inside his cl and sticks it to his mouth. Six blow-darts nail Frankenstein in the back. He bellows spins around, arms flailing at his back, trying to swat t darts free. Anna runs over and picks up one of the revolv off the ground next to Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We must kill it. Van Helsing grabs her by the wrist.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: No! Wait. Frankenstein crashes to his knees, his bleary eyes look o at them.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: If you value your lives, and the lives of your kind, you will kill me. Van Helsing pulls Anna behind him and heads for Frankenst whose breathing is getting more and more labored.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If Dracula finds me I am the key to my father's machine the key to life, life for Dracula's children!  66.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: He already awakened them, last night.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Those were just from one bride, from one single birthing. And they died as they did the last time he tried. Only with me can he give them lasting life. Van Helsing kneels down beside Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: There are more? More of those things? Frankenstein's pathetic eyes stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Thousands ... thousands more. Frankenstein passes out, crashing face first into the dir WE PUSH IN on Van Helsing as the gravity of this hits him Anna isn't fazed, she lifts the gun and aims. Van Helsing steps in front of her. She angrily looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You heard what he said. Van Helsing holds her stare, searching for the words ....

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: My life, my ... job... is to vanquish evil. I can sense evil. (gestures to Frankenstein) This thing ... man ... whatever it is, evil may have created it, left its mark on it, but evil does not rule it. So I cannot kill it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I can. She moves around him. He blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not while I'm here. Anna sees the intensity in his eyes. Behind them, hidden the shadows, is the Werewolf, staring at Frankenstein.  67.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your family has spent four hundred years trying to kill Dracula, maybe this poor creature can help us find a way. The Werewolf slowly starts to back away. Van Helsing sudd senses it and spins around. He and Anna see the Werewolf' shadow vanish down the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. He's seen us. (she turns to Van Helsing) Now they'll come for him. And neither you or I will be able to stop them. Van Helsing grabs her arm and heads for Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I must get him to Rome. We can protect him there. On Anna's dubious look WE SMASH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEAM blasts out of the nostrils of huge black horses, covered in a light armor plating, coupled to an ornate CO Van Helsing and Carl walk down alongside them.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: --. and then the painting came alive and the two creatures attacked each other.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I don't know. Anna opens the door to the coach. Frankenstein is inside, chained to the back wall. Van Helsing nudges Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't stare at him.  68.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I'm staring at him. (quickly turns away) Is that a man? Van Helsing shoves Carl up into the seat across from Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Actually it's seven men, parts of them anyway. Frankenstein struggles to break the chains that bind him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: By exposing me, you have condemned me. Me and all of humanity! Anna slams the door shut and gestures to the horses.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Nothing is faster than Transylvanian steeds. Not even a werewolf Anything else, you're on your own.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: On the bottom half of the SCREEN, the coach races across countryside. On the top half, the sky is whipping past in TIME LAPSE. Dark clouds scream by showing us glimpses of sun as it races right to left across the SCREEN. As the s exits FRAME the moon comes up and the TIME LAPSE ends revealing an ominous night sky. The coach races into a da forest. Two Bride silhouettes fly past and follow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black steeds charge through the woods pulling the COA Van Helsing is in the driver's seat urging them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein stomps his Doc Martens and yells out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Free me! Let me fight! Let me die! But do not let me be taken alive! Sitting across from him is Carl, eyes wide, really keyed the blowgun stuck to his lips.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA is suddenly hurtling through the misty forest about Mach 1. The BRIDE'S POV quickly closes in on the co Van Helsing senses them coming, he looks around, the cree trees sway in the breeze, but he can't see the brides. He hefts the crossbow. He hears something off to his left an looks. And that's when Verona swoops down on his right an grabs him jerking him clean off the driver's seat and up the air. The crossbow goes flying. Van Helsing quickly br free and falls down onto the lead horse. He looks forward A hundred yards ahead, the path makes a hairpin turn next a giant precipice. Van Helsing quickly looks back at the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach bounces hard. Frankenstein is thrown forward at Carl. Carl screams, but the chains hold Frankenstein just short of falling on him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Where are you going to go? I don't know if you've looked in the mirror lately, but you kind of stick our in a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing leaps from the front horse to the middle hors the rear horse and then up onto the buckboard. And that's when Aleera nails him on the fly, throwing him back onto rear horse. All of the horses try to make the turn, going full boar, hoofs fighting to avoid slipping over the edge, kicking r our into space. Van Helsing holds on for dear life. The c skids sideways, the couplings SNAP and the coach is flung over the void. Van Helsing spins up into a saddle in time to see the coa spiraling through the air, heading for the valley floor f below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH UP IN THE AIR: Aleera and Verona freak out.  70.

dialogues.speaker: VERONA
dialogues.text: We must not let him be destroyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Brides fly as fast as they can towards the plumme coach. They both grab it, but its weight is far too great them to stop it from falling. Aleera is losing her grip.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Save him! Save the monster! Aleera is blown off Verona struggles her way to the door, wings are being badly buffeted. She grabs the door and ri it off, then looks inside. The coach is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK WITH VAN HELSING as ANOTHER COACH races out of the forest and up to the six team. Anna in the driver's seat. Carl leans out the window. Frankenstein is chained inside

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Come on! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK INSIDE THE OTHER COACH: Verona sees a bunch of glyce tubes wrapped around a dozen SILVER SPIKES. Verona hisses anger and throws herself free of the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach hits the ground and EXPLODES. Several of the sp nail Verona in the chest. She shrieks in horror and then TRANSFORMS back into herself. Losing her wings, she drops of the sky, DECAYING into molten rot, shrieking all the w Aleera screeches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing leaps from the six team onto the buckboard of other coach, landing next to Anna. He gives Anna a nudge the ribs and a cocky smile, as if to say, "I told you it would work." And that's when 800 pounds of enraged fur le over the entire six team, heading right for Van Helsing a Anna.  71. Van Helsing quickly rolls off one way as Anna flings hers off the other. The Werewolf slams into the buckboard and skids sideways across the roof, shattering all four corne lanterns. The Werewolf vanishes off the back of the coach the kerosene and the entire roof bursts into flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl frantically looks around, then sees Anna's face plastered to the window.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Carl leaps over and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is hanging on to the side of the coach, which is now skirting a huge precipice a mile deep. Carl grabs her as starts to slip. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE COACH: Van Helsing is being violently dragged down the road, desperately clinging by hand to the axle of the coach. His legs splitting the rea wheel, if he lets go he'll be run over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks past Frankenstein to the other side of the coa He can't let go of Anna or she'll fall. He looks at Frankenstein. Frankenstein nods.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: I can help.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You won't kill me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Only if you don't hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing grimaces in pain, his five fingers cling to t axle, then four fingers, then three, two, one. He lets go heads under the rear wheel. And that's when a huge fist g him by the collar and pulls him free. It's Frankenstein.  72. The two men share a look, then Frankenstein heaves Van Helsing upwards. He lands on the buckboard just as Anna swings up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at Frankenstein and smiles in relief, then he screams bloody murder as he sees FUR moving across the re window. And then the roof splits open and fire and smoke pours in. Now it's Frankenstein's turn to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna look back through the fire towards t rear of the coach. In SLO-MO the Werewolf rises up throug the flames. The side door of the coach smashes open and Frankenstein Carl look out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Don't look down.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I'm looking down! I'm looking down! The coach makes it across the precipice road and enters t forest. The Werewolf hunches. Van Helsing YELLS at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Jump ! Anna turns and leaps off the carriage. So does Carl and Frankenstein. They all vanish into the lush forest. Van Helsing aims both of his guns down at the coupling an fires. The horses break loose of the carriage. Van Helsin turns and jumps. The Werewolf leaps through the flames. Van Helsing spins around in mid-air and fires his guns ba at the Werewolf just as it tackles him. They vanish into foliage. The flaming coach flips off the road, spirals through the air and crashes into the trees. The six team hauls-ass down the forest road, vanishing into the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna staggers through the forest, she rounds a tree, her breath hitches. Lying naked on the ground is her brother. looks up and gives his sister one last sorrowful look.  73.

dialogues.speaker: VELKAN
dialogues.text: Forgive me. And then he dies. Anna throws herself onto Velkan's body.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Velkan! ... Velkan! ... Velkan. She cradles him gently and kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will see you again. Nearby, Van Helsing staggers to his feet. Anna looks at h then leaps up and charges him, pummeling him with her fis

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You killed him! You killed him! Van Helsing grabs her by the wrists and holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Now you know why they call me murderer. Anna looks into his eyes, they are not angry, but filled a profound sadness. And then Anna notices BLOOD on his sh she gently opens his cloak. Anna gasps. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh my god ... Van Helsing's shirt is punctured with bloody fang holes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've been bitten. She staggers back and looks at him, she sees it in his ey A hint of it anyway. Fear. Van Helsing turns and looks do at Velkan's body. Anna turns away. Aleera is standing rig there. She backhands Anna. Anna slams into a tree and drops to the ground, our cold. Helsing spins around in time to catch a glimpse of Anna, upside down, being yanked up into the trees. Van Helsing hauls-ass.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing runs out onto the side of a cliff. He sees An being carried off over the precipice by Aleera. Carl and Frankenstein stagger up beside him. All three of them wat the silhouettes of Anna and Aleera flying off towards the lights of a distant city ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled in a lush valley and split in half by a dark rive the city is sprinkled with churches, mosques, and palaces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing, Carl, and Frankenstein stagger down an alley Battered and bruised. Frankenstein's face is covered by a hood. Van Helsing pulls his cloak tight, keeping his woun hidden. A blast of wind hits them. They all react, Van Helsing flinches in pain as he pulls his gun. Perched on the snowy eve of a house is Aleera, she clicks tongue in disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Tch, tch, tch, so much trouble to my Master, so much trouble. Frankenstein starts to head for her. Van Helsing stays hi Aleera just giggles.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You killed Verona. If the Master was capable of love, he would have loved her very much. As for me ... (she smiles coquettishly) +.. now I will have the Master's undivided attention.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: The Master commands a trade. The monster for the Princess. Frankenstein glares at her angrily, and then he hears Van Helsing's VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Somewhere public. Lots of people.  75. Frankenstein looks at Van Helsing, feeling betrayed, his furrows, his eyes darken. Van Helsing's eyes stay on Alee

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A place where your master will be less inclined to expose his ... other side. Aleera chews this over for a moment, then her eyes light

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night is All Hallow's Eve! Here in Budapest there is a wonderful masquerade ball. She leaps for joy, all the way up to the top of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love masquerade balls! (she looks down at them) Vilkovia Palace. Midnight. Then she whoops for joy and leaps again, vanishing over t side of the roof, followed by a blast of wind and snow. Van Helsing holsters his gun and rums to go, he winces in pain. Carl sees this and reaches for Van Helsing's cloak.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? Van Helsing shoves his hand away. Frankenstein's eyes nar suspiciously, then he lunges forward and rips Van Helsing cloak open, revealing the puncture wounds in his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: He has been bitten! Bitten by a werewolf. Van Helsing pulls his cloak tight. Frankenstein's face fo a twisted smile.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you will become that which you have hunted so passionately. Helsing pulls out the BLOWGUN and looks at Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. And he means it. Frankenstein just glares.  76.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: May others be as passionate in their hunting of you. Van Helsing FIRES THE DARTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last shadows of the day stretch like creepy fingers across an ancient ROYAL GRAVEYARD. Wearing costumes and masks, Van Helsing and Carl step out of an old MAUSOLEUM. They shove the huge stone door shut and bar it tight.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: According to the books, you wont turn into a werewolf until the rising of your first full moon, two nights from now, and then you'll still be able to fight Dracula's hold over you until the final stroke of midnight. The two men make their way through the tombstones, headin for a huge, ornate PALACE next door.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Sounds like I have nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you should be terrified. Van Helsing gives him a look. Then Carl gets It.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh ... well, urn, that still gives us forty-eight hours to find a solution. Carl looks back at the mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you sure he can't get out of there?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not without some help from the dead. TIGHT on a COFFIN, lying in the frozen ground, waiting to buried. The lid cracks open, gnarled fingers pry their wa out.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand ballroom is packed with dancing couples and ali with JUGGLERS, FIRE BLOWERS, TIGHT ROPE WALKERS, and HIGH WIRE ACROBATS, a veritable Cirque du Solei!' Van Helsing Carl make their way through all the weirdness.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Well, this is different.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Dracula must have something up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: So in situations like this, do we have a solid plan? Or do we just improvise?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: A bit of both actually. They step up to the ornate banquet tables. Van Helsing inhales deeply. Carl does likewise.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Smells wonderful, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not everything.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: What do you smell?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Everything. Van Helsing looks around, suddenly very SUSPICIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Warm pretzels, juniper bushes, ladies perfume, and rotted human flesh. Carl gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You sure do know how to put a damper on the evening.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUT ON THE DANCE FLOOR: Dracula dances with Anna, both wearing masks. He dips her and removes her mask. She is i trance. Eyes open, unblinking. Dracula throws away his ma and kisses her. Anna snaps out of it. Dracula spins her around.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: How does it feel to be a puppet on my string? Anna suddenly looks around, realizing she's dancing with Dracula. She struggles, but is completely within his powe

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I wont let you trade me, Count.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: I have no intention of trading you. And if I know Van Helsing, which I do, he isn't planning on making a trade either. He dips her and leans in close, their lips almost touchin

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Neither of us has ever settled for half.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You make my skin craw!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That's not all I could do with your skin. Dracula gently caresses her neck. Aleera cuts in and grab Anna away from Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: My rum. Aleera dances away with Anna. Dracula smiles, then random grabs a passing woman, yanks her close and bites into her neck. The ballroom is in such high swing no one notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ON THE SECOND FLOOR: Van Helsing and Carl look down on ballroom. Carl spots Aleera dancing with Anna.  79.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Something's not right.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes, they're both trying to lead.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not that. And then Van Helsing spots something, his eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Carl?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I have a plan. I need you to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ON THE DANCE FLOOR: Aleera dances Anna across the fl

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: It's the little things in life that I love. Like that last look in my victim's eyes just before they die. We see in Anna's eyes how hard she's struggling to break free. Aleera licks Anna's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I won't let the Master take you, Anna. AleeraвЂ™s canines distend into horrible fangs, draining her beautiful face.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want him all to myself. Anna's eyes widen, helpless in Aleera's grasp. And that's when Dracula cuts in, he giver Aleera a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You look famished, my dear, go get yourself a bite.  80. Aleera scowls as Dracula spins Anna over to a MIRROR WALL

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't we make a beautiful couple? Anna looks at the mirror. Dracula is not in the reflectio He starts to dance with her in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a new bride, Anna, someone strong and beautiful. In the mirror it looks like Anna is dancing alone, seemin being dipped and spun and twirled by an invisible force.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All it takes is one bite from me. He hugs her tighter. Anna looks from his face to his ches crushed tightly against her breasts, her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You have no heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Perhaps it just needs to be rekindled. Dracula leans in for a kiss. Anna angrily turns her head away, so she doesn't see all the blood drain from Dracula face and his canines distend into fangs, about to bite in her neck. A Fire Breather tilts his head safely up and away from th crowd, lifts a torch to his mouth and starts to BLOW Carl quickly sidles up and shoves him hard. The Fire Breather BLOWS FLAMES across the back of Dracula's cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ON THE BALCONY: Van Helsing dashes down the HIGH WIRE. TIGHT ROPE WALKERS start to lose their balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN ON THE DANCE FLOOR: Dracula whirls around, ON FIRE, shocked and angry.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ABOVE THE DANCE FLOOR: Van Helsing curs a stay-wire, grabs on and SWINGS DOWN into the crowd. The Tight Rope Walkers ALL FALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula grabs the Fire Breather and tosses him dear acros the ballroom. Van Helsing swoops in, grabs Anna by her wa and swings her up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ON THE BALCONY: Van Helsing and Anna land, skid to a s and look down. The entire crowd looks up at our heroes. And then, in uni they all remove their masks. Their eyes go yellow, their goes white, fangs glide out, they HISS angrily. They are VAMPIRES. Dracula smiles up at Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Welcome to my summer palace. A side door bursts open and a batch of vampires charge in carrying Frankenstein over their heads, he's chained tigh and bellowing furiously. Igor stands on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: We have him, Master! We have him! Dracula gives an evil LAUGH, then looks at his followers gestures to Van Helsing and Anna.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Enjoy yourselves! The entire vampire crowd rushes forward, SHRIEKING like w Banshees. Anna's response is to rip the arm off a SUIT OF ARMOR, st her hand down the sleeve and into its metal glove, attach to the glove is an IRON MACE covered in spikes. Van Helsi response is to give her an incredulous look, then grab he and yank her out of FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna race down a hallway.  82.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Where are we going!? Van Helsing points to a huge STAINED GLASS WINDOW of ange cherubs, and saints.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Through that window!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?! We'll be cut to ribbons!

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not if you relax when you're going through it. At the last second Van Helsing notices one of the SAINTS his hand out, as if to say "STOP." Van Helsing grabs Anna skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My mistake, wrong window.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Just a hunch. He yanks her out of FRAME. Vampires bound past, chasing a them. Dracula's LAUGH echoes throughout the palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Anna race up some stairs and through a se double doors, vampires hot on their tail. They each grab door, slam it shut and bolt it tight. The vampires furiou smash away from the other side. Van Helsing and Anna high tail it down the hall. Carl comes scurrying around a corner at the far end of th hallway. He sees Van Helsing and Anna running towards him holds up his LAVA CONTRAPTION.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Now I know what it's for. Carl is standing in front of another huge window.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are we going?  83.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING/ANNA
dialogues.text: Through that window! Carl turns around to see the window they're talking about pulls the pin on his contraption. Van Helsing and Anna ea grab one of Carl's arms, on the run, and yank him out thr the great glass window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing, Anna, and Carl crash through the shower of g and drop rwo stories down into a watery CATACOMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge door disintegrates as the vampires crash through They bound down the hallway. The contraption is sitting o the floor, it pops open, rays of ULTRA VIOLET LIGHT strea out. The vampires all melt screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing, Anna, and Carl burst to the surface inside a large moldy catacomb filled with skulls and skeletons, th huge EXPLOSION OF LIGHT finishing above them as pieces of melted vampire splash down around them.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Carl, you're a genius.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (a bit freaked out) A genius with access to unstable chemicals. Behind them, Igor YELLS commands in Hungarian as he and a dozen of the porcine Dwergi ride a LONGBOAT down a ramp, Frankenstein chained to the mast. Van Helsing immediately heads for the longboat. Igor and the Dwergi drop their oars into the water and st to row. Van Helsing runs faster. Igor and the Dwergi padd out of a tunnel and into the river. A huge grated GATE st to drop down behind them. Igor pats Frankenstein on the h

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Say goodbye to your friends. Frankenstein BELLOWS angrily. Igor cackles.  84.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because where we are taking you, only God and the devil know. The metal gate SLAMS SHUT right in front of Van Helsing, cutting him off from the river, he splashes up to it and stares out through the grates. Frankenstein looks back at Helsing. Frankenstein's hag-gard face a mask of helplessn and hopelessness, looking forlorn and abandoned. Van Hels stares at him and grits his teeth in determination.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I'll find you!... I'll get you back and set you free. I swear to god. A huge DARK SHADOW swoops past, its talons scrape across metal grating, SPARKS FLY.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: God hasn't helped you in years, Van Helsing, why should he start now!? We hear Aleera LAUGH as the two dark shadows flyaway. Ann and Carl run up beside Van Helsing. Anna grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Come on, we've got to beat them back to Castle Frankenstein. Van Helsing whirls around and starts to go.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Yes, I've got to save that creature.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Van Helsing! Van Helsing turns back to Carl, who is till staring out through the grate.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I cabled Rome earlier, to apprise them of our situation. Van Helsing gives Carl a suspicious look.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And what did they say? Carl turns to face him.  85.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Even if you do somehow kill Dracula... Rome orders you to destroy Frankenstein as well. Van Helsing's eyes darken, he starts to rev up.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: He isn't evil.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes, but they said he isn't human either. Van Helsing furiously closes in on Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Do they know him? Have they talked with him? Who are they to judge!?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: They want you to destroy him so he can never be used to harm humanity. Van Helsing angrily grabs Carl by the throat and lifts hi off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And what of me? Did you tell them what I am to become? Did they tell you how to kill me? The correct angle of the stake as it enters my heart?! The exact measure of silver in each bullet!! Van Helsing's voice has gotten incredibly deeper during t speech, his eyes have gone dark red and he's strangling C Anna is already trying to rip the two men apart, but Van Helsing's strength is too much for her. Carl gasps:

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No .... I... I left you out. Van Helsing snaps out of it and lets him go. Carl drops t the ground, sucking air. Van Helsing stares down at him, feeling terribly, then he looks at his shaking hands, a whirlwind of emotions passing over his face, he clenches hands into fists, then exhales deeply and looks at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: It's starting.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing, Anna, and Carl run into the laboratory. It's empty, all of the lab equipment has been hurriedly remove

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: They must have taken all the equipment to Dracula's lair.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Then we've lost.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Dracula cannot bring his children to life until the sun sets. We still have time.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (incredulous) "Time?" The sun sets in two hours, and we've been searching for him for more than four hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I wasn't around for those four hundred years, now was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rays of the mid-day sun are trying to pry their way through the cloud-streaked sky over Manor Valerious. We c hear Van Helsing, Anna, and Carl pounding up a staIrcase.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So what did you learn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes enter the tower bedroom where they come upon t mass of relics, artifacts, and texts.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: That Count Dracula was actually the son of Valerio us the Elder. Carl looks at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The son of you're ancestor. Anna just shrugs, no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows that, what else?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, right. Well, it all started in 1462, when Dracula was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Does it say who murdered him?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: No, just some vague reference to the Left Hand of God. Van Helsing looks intrigued. Carl opens the elaborately inscribed SACRED LATIN TEXT.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway, according to this when Dracula died he made a covenant with the devil. Van Helsing and Anna jump in, guessing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And was given a new life.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: But the only way to sustain that life was by drinking the blood of others.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Are you two going to let me tell the story?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING/ANNA
dialogues.text: Sorry. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Your ancestor, having sired this evil creature, went to Rome to seek forgiveness from God, that's when the bargain was made, Valerious the Elder was to kill Dracula in return for the eternal salvation of his entire family, right down the line all the way to you. He points to Anna. Anna nods in understanding.  88.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: But he couldn't do it. As evil as Dracula was, my ancestor could not kill his own son. Carl points at some of the fantastical engravings on the relics and artifacts, helping tell the story:

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: So he banished Dracula to an icy fortress, sending him through a door from which there was no return.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And then the devil gave him wings.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: All right, so where is this door?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I don't know, but when the old knight couldn't kill his son, he left clues, so that future generations might do it for him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That must be what my father was looking for in here, clues to the door's location. An idea suddenly springs into Van Helsing's head.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: The door... The door... of course! He turns and races out of the room. Anna and Carl exchang look, then haul-ass after Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing runs up to the massive floor-to-ceiling OIL PAINTING of Transylvania. Anna and Carl right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You said your father spent hours staring at this painting, trying to find Dracula's lair, I think you were right, quite literally.  89. Van Helsing checks where the frame meets the wall, but th frame is actually molded into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think this is the door. He just didn't know how to open it. Carl points to a LATIN INSCRIPTION on the painting.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Look! A Latin inscription. Maybe it works like that painting in the tower. Carl starts mumbling the inscription in Latin. Anna steps to Van Helsing

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: If this was a door, my father would have opened it long ago. Carl shoves a chair aside, revealing a missing piece of t painting.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I can't finish the inscription. There's a piece missing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Your father didn't have this. Van Helsing pulls out the torn piece of painted cloth.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Where did you get that? Van Helsing hands the painted piece of cloth to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Finish it. Carl places it inside the missing piece of the map. The t piece is a perfect match. Carl finishes the inscription.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Deum lacessat ac ianuam imbeat apenn.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: In the name of God, open this door.  90. And that's when the painting begins to change, starting a the frame line and spreading inward, a THICK CRYSTAL FROS washes over the painting, eating it up until the painting completely dissolved, leaving an ANCIENT MIRROR in its pl

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: A mirror? Anna stares at it, thinking hard.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Dracula has no reflection in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Maybe ... maybe to Dracula, it's not a mirror at all. Van Helsing reaches out to touch the mirror, his hand goe straight through it, vanishing inside it, he inhales shar Carl Jumps.

dialogues.speaker: CARL/ANNA
dialogues.text: What? What?!

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: It's cold. He pulls his hand out to reveal SNOWFLAKES in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it's snowing. Van Helsing grabs a TORCH out of a sconce on the wall, an prepares to step through.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See you on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we're behind you ... not right behind you, but behind you. Anna grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Be careful.  91. Van Helsing gives her a nod, then steps straight through mirror, vanishing inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing steps out of another ancient mirror, encased huge black OBELISK. It's snowing. A beat later, Anna step through. They both look up. Chiselled out of a massive ro mountain is an enormous cathedral-like fortress; spires, turrets, gargoyles, the works. Covered in permafrost. Ici everywhere. Carelessly flung hither and yon are human skeletons. Something very evil lives here. THUNDER RUMBLE

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Castle Dracula. They look back at the mirror. Carl is nowhere in sight. T head for the castle. Behind them, Carl slowly seeps out o the mirror, eyes closed, he opens them to see the forbidd fortress. The sheer enormity of it terrifies him. He spin around and runs back into the mirror-wham! Face first, bounces off and lands on his ass. The mirror is a one-way ticket. Carl leaps up and scurries after them.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a massive door at the front of the ancient fortress, made of iron, rusted shut, covered in slippery There's a TRANSOM at the top of it, but it's thirty feet

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Do we have a plan? It doesn't have to be Wellington's at Waterloo, but some sort of plan would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: We're going to go in there and stop Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And kill anything that gets in our way. Carl starts to back away.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Let me know how that goes. Van Helsing grabs Carl and Anna by their collars and runs straight up, thirty feet, they go right through the trans  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them land softly on the floor on the other s Anna and Carl are shocked, they turn and look at Van Hels

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Well, as grateful as I am to be out of the cold, that doesn't seem like a good thing. Anna looks at Van Helsing, bent over in pain, his face an eyes ate distorted into a vague resemblance of a wolf, an then it passes. They share a look. Then he moves forward, a man on a mission. The whole plac a massive frozen foyer, and all of the incredibly high wa pillars, and ceilings are covered in gooey COCOONS. Thous of them. With electric wires sticking out of all of them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, if he brings all of these to life ...

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: -.. the world would be a smorgasbord. And that's when Igor comes scurrying around a comer, a bu of wires and electrodes in his hands, he skids to a stop, looking stunned as he sees Van Helsing.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: How? How did you? ... It's impossible. He quickly recovers his senses, drops everything and runs like hell. Van Helsing pumps one of the saw blades into h palm and throws it, it whistles through the air, catches by his sleeve, and pins him to a rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please! Please don't kill me! Van Helsing strides forward.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Well, urn, I... He can't think of a good reason. Van Helsing rips the bla out of the wall, about to kill him.  93. And then they hear Frankenstein BELLOW Somewhere nearby. look around. Right next to Igor is a window with metal ba Van Helsing sees something moving inside it. It's a PULLE with chains. He sticks his torch through the bars and loo down a SHAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein is in a DUNGEON CELL encased in a huge BLOCK ICE, only his head and neck stick out, chains run through block and attach up to the pulley. The shaft rises anothe thirty floors. From the top of the shaft a VOICE rings ou

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bring me the monster...!! Dracula's voice ECHOES through the immense fortress as Ig snickers evilly.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: My Master has awakened. The pulley starts to rise. The chains snap taut. Frankens and the block of ice quickly lift up off the cell floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing drops the torch and goes nuts, furiously yank and pulling on the thick bars with incredible strength, t actually start to twist, but they're never going to give, even with the semi-insane look which has crept into his e Anna tries to help, to no avail. The block of ice continues its rise. Van Helsing collapse against the bars, the insane look seeps away, he's back t himself once again. Frankenstein comes eye-to-eye with hi The two beings look at each other, a real connection betw the two of them. The look on Frankenstein's face softens.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: There is a cure. Van Helsing is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Dracula, he has the cure, to remove the curse of the Werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein continues up the shaft. Van Helsing desperat tries to stick his head through the bars, gaining one las look up at Frankenstein as he's hauled up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! Find the cure! Save yourself! Anna grabs Van Helsing and pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Come on! You heard him! Let's find it. Van Helsing looks at her, thinking hard.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Why does Dracula have a cure?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: I do. Why would he need one? Van Helsing looks at Igor. Igor clamps his mouth shut. Th CAMERA does a dramatic PUSH IN on Carl as his face fills a dawning realization:

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Because the only thing that can kill him ... is a werewolf. Van Helsing and Anna look at Carl. Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The painting. That's what it meant.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: But Dracula has used werewolves to do his biding for centuries.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Yes, but if one ever had the will to turn on him, he'd need a cure to remove the curse and make it human before it bit him. The realization of this crashes down on them. Van Helsing turns to Igor and gestures to Anna and Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You're going to take these two and lead them to it.  95.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: No I'm not. Van Helsing sticks the blade under Igor's chin. Igor smil

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes I am. Carl steps up.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: When the bell begins to roll midnight, you'll be able to kill Dracula, we just have to find the cure and get it into you before the final stroke. Van Helsing pulls a small but extremely nasty-looking WEA out of his cloak. It looks like nail clippers designed by Spanish Inquisition. He holds it up in front of Igor's fa

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: If they even suspect you're misleading them ... He hands the weapon to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --. Clip off one of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Igor looks terrified, he gestures to the set of staircase

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: The stairs on the right, they lead to the black tower, that's where it is.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: And the stairs on the left? Igor hesitates. Van Helsing reaches for the "clippers. "

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: The Devil's tower! Devil's tower! That's where we reassembled the laboratory. Would I lie to you?

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Not if you wanted to live.  96. Van Helsing turns to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I'm not "cured" by the twelfth stroke of midnight ... He pulls a metal tube out of his cloak, naps out into a SILVER STAKE, and hands it to Carl. Carl's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I don't think I could.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: You must. Carl nods, takes the stake, shares a look with Van Helsin and then grabs Igor by the scruff of his neck and pulls h off towards the staircases.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Come on. Van Helsing and Anna look into each other's eyes, both of them scared, both of them gearing up. Van Helsing has nev been so concerned for another human being in his life.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Don't get killed. Anna has never been so filled with conviction in her life

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You still don't understand. It doesn't matter what happens to me. We must save my family. She starts to go. Van Helsing pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: If you're late ... run like hell. She nods and starts to go. Van Helsing Pulls her back aga

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be late. She smiles and starts to go. Van Helsing pulls her back again, and then kisses her hard. She gives it right back him, a real bodice ripper, she pulls herself away, stares deep into his smoldering eyes, then runs off after Carl.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dwergi are putting the final touches em the reassembl Victor Frankenstein's equipment. Frankenstein himself is welded into the iron pod, bellowing angrily. Dracula stri past, slamming all of the huge electrical switches on.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: What ate you complaining about? The entire laboratory sparks to life. Spectacular arcs of electricity shoot up and down the walls between the dynam The gears kick in. The fan belts snap taut and start to s

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is why you were made, to prove that god is not the only one who can create life! Dracula turns the flywheel. Frankenstein begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now you will give that life to my young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing comes up the spiraling stone staircase and se large gash in the rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing steps inside and sees CHAINS jangling in the middle of the dark shaft, he looks down at the fifteen-st drop. And then he jumps. He grabs the chains, swings wild dangling precariously, some of his weapons drop out of hi cloak and fall. And then, with superhuman strength, agili and speed, Van Helsing starts to climb the chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor leads Anna and Carl up the stairs to a landing with arched doorway, the entrance to the Antidote Tower.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: There it is. Inside the large room is a pedestal. On the pedestal is a GLASS JAR filled with a clear jelly-like goo, suspended i the goo is a SYRINGE. Igor starts to enter. Anna grabs hi and holds him back.  98.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'll go first. Igor gives her a nasty look. Anna gives it back to him, t enters the tower, eyes on the alert, heading for the syri All the windows are barred shut. There is no other entran Carl watches her, his eyes momentarily off Igor. Igor use the moment, takes a quick step back, and with the heel of boot, kicks Carl in the ass. Anna spins around in time to Carl sprawl into the room. Igor cackles gleefully.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: Stay as long as you like. He pulls a lever on the wall, a grated metal gate crashes down, locking Anna and Carl inside the tower. Igor scurri away laughing.

dialogues.speaker: IGOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye-bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the equipment is accelerating wildly. The Dwergi are desperately trying to keep everything from spinning out of control. Dracula is in rapture as sparks down upon him. Van Helsing climbs up out of the shaft and hides behind t shattered block of ice, which is being pelted and melted raining sparks. Dynamos crackle. Pulleys whirl. Electrica arcs flash. Van Helsing looks up. Sixty feet above him is OPEN SKYLIGHT, twenty feet above that is the POD apparatu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein struggles in the pod as LIGHTNING FLASHES ac the sky above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Carl are staring at the syringe inside the jar o vile goo.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Go ahead, grab it.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You go ahead and grab it. If there's one thing I've learned, it's never be the first one to stick your hand into a viscous material. A hideous FACE lowers down right behind them. It's Aleera

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Smart boy. Carl practically jumps out of his skin. Anna grabs Carl a jerks him back behind the huge jar. Aleera drops down wit smile.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I scare you?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (terrified) No.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Then maybe I need to try a little harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing starts to climb STRAIGHT UP THE SHEER WALL. Grasping for purchase in the grouting. Only someone with superhuman strength in their fingertips could do this. A Dwerger on scaffolding turns around and comes face-to-f with Van Helsing, clinging to the wall like a fly. The Dwerger's goggles are up and we get our first glimpse of hideous Dwergi eyes. Before the Dwerger can even scream, Helsing grabs him with one hand, slams him off the rock w then chucks him into the dark recesses of the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna suddenly lashes out with her sword and knocks over t jar. It crashes to the floor, splattering some goo on Ale The vile goo burns like acid into her and right through t stone floor. Aleera HOWLS in pain and rage. Carl freaks.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: See! What did I tell you!? Anna gestures to the syringe rolling across the floor.  100.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Grab it! Grab it! Grab it! Using the hem of his frock, Carl scoops up the syringe, i burns and smokes and he jumps and yelps, but he still man to hold onto it. In the meantime, Anna has grabbed a piec the glass and scooped up some of the goo. She runs and fl it at the bars of the gate. A hole melts through the bars

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon! Carl races to the hole, the syringe smoking-up his frock. Anna shoves Carl out first.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! Carl races off down the hall. Before Anna can get out, a grabs her and spins her around. It's Aleera. The burns on face HEAL.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: You can't go until I say you can go.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: And I'll say you can go when you're dead. Aleera grabs Anna and throws her across the floor. Anna s across the room, her sabre goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the pod Van Helsing comes eye-to-eye with Frankenst The WIND whips at them. LIGHTNING FLASHES. THUNDER ROARS. Helsing grabs one of the three metal straps welded onto t bolts riveted down Frankenstein's chest.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: This is going to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: (grits his teeth) I am accustomed to pain. Van Helsing nods, bad-to-the-bone.  101.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Lets you know you're alive. With his new strength, Van Helsing rips the first metal s off. Frankenstein grimaces in pain. And that's when a BOL LIGHTNING STRIKES the conductor above the pod. Van Helsin catapulted into the air. Frankenstein roars in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula looks up as a BLAST OF ENERGY emanates from the p down into the room and through the equipment, which insta OVERLOADS, spitting FLAMES and SPARKS. One of the Dwergi blown across the room, ON FIRE. Dracula smiles maniacally

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Give me LIFE!!! The blast of energy surges out through every door, crack, pore of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The energy blast envelops the entrance hall washing over the cocoons, which begin to UNDULATE with life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing dangles from the edge of the tower, it's a si floor drop to an icy canyon below, electrical wires crack and spit all around him. He starts to claw his way back u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna staggers to her feet as Aleera strides towards her. grabs a torch off the wall and lunges at Aleera's face. Aleera just blows it out. Anna quickly backs away. Aleera smiles, then one by one she blows out all of the torches the room until the place goes PITCH BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weather has gone insane. Thunder, lightning, rain and wind whip down around Cart as he runs out, onto an enormo ancient STONE BRIDGE that connects the two towers. It's covered in huge potholes and barbed rubble. A LIGHTNING STRIKE hits one of the stone pilasters on the bridge. It' going to be a very difficult six hundred yard dash. And that's when Igor runs out with his cattle prod. Carl out of the way as the prod slams into the railing right n to him, just missing him, spitting sparks.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing rips the second metal strap off of Frankenste Frankenstein grimaces in pain, then he sees something com

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Look out! Van Helsing throws himself to the floor of the apparatus once again LIGHTNING STRIKES the conductor above the pod. Frankenstein roars in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another energy blast surges through the room. Dracula lif his arms and eyes to the sky in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: One more bolt and my young shall live! And then he sees Van Helsing high above him. Dracula scow and TRANSFORMS into a HIDEOUS WINGED BEAST FROM HELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
