dialogues.text: Pitch black. And then a lightning strike illuminates Anna groping her way around the room, WE RACK FOCUS to see Ale hanging upside down from the ceiling twenty feet behind h WE PUSH IN ON Aleera's gleaming face. And then go to her Aleera can see perfectly in the dark. She watches as Anna gropes her way across the dark wall, heading for the gate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKS explode off the tip of the cattle prod as it slams into a pilaster right next to Carl's head. Carl takes off running across the ancient bridge towards the distant tow Igor chases after him with the sparking prod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing rips the last metal strap off of Frankenstein And that's when the hideous Winged Dracula Beast swoops u and rips into Van Helsing, throwing him back. Van Helsing bounces off the apparatus and drops-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -sixty feet down through the room, crashing through the equipment on his way. SPARKS FLY. FLAMES BLOW Dwergi run.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein stands up, dazed, about to step out of the p Another BOLT OF LIGHTNING strikes the conductor. It light Frankenstein up like a Christmas tree and catapults him through the air. An energy blast surges down into the lab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And washes over the cocoons. The cocoons begin to EXPLODE Hundreds and hundreds of the hideous pygmy bats burst out swarm around the great hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna makes it to the gate. Lightning flashes, revealing Aleera standing on the other side of it, she punches Anna across the room. Anna slams into a wall and drops like a of potatoes, out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein clings to the edge of the tower, struggling hold on as electrical wires spark and spit all around him loses his grip and starts to drop. It's sixty stories dow He manages to grab a wire, which snaps loose and swings h down and across the castle, his legs kicking wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs like mad, weaving and bobbing as Igor tries to him with the cattle prod. Carl suddenly sees Frankenstein swinging on a wire, coming right at him. Carl dives to th ground as the wire whips over his head. The wire catches across the chest and launches him out over the railing. T wire then catches on a pilaster whipping Frankenstein int the bridge. Igor drops past him, screaming in terror on h long journey down to the icy valley below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna groggily rolls over on the floor. Aleera steps up ov her, then grabs her and lifts her up while TRANSFORMING i a huge winged bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered and bloody, Van Helsing staggers through the bur equipment, looking delirious.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks over the railing. Sees Frankenstein hanging by wire, dangling sixty stories up, losing his grip, sliding down the last five feet of the wire, now four feet, now t feet, two feet, one. He looks up at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: Help ... me. Carl is emotionally torn.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You're supposed to die. Frankenstein grimaces, desperately clinging to life.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: I want to live. Carl makes his decision.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: All right! All right! Hold on! Hold on! Carl sticks the syringe between his teeth, grabs the connector wire and pulls with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna can barely move, choking from the incredible grip Al has on her throat. Aleera's hideous face smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Be happy in the knowledge that I shall weep over your dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gives one last tug. The wire breaks loose from the pilaster. Frankenstein swings away from the bridge and ar up towards a barred window on the side of the Antidote To

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aleera's fangs distend, she leans into bite Anna's neck. that's when Frankenstein crashes through the barred windo and slams into them. Anna is knocked free.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge Winged Beast strides through the flames, then TRANSFORMS back into Dracula, a smile on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You're too late, my friend! My live! Van Helsing backs away, really mess

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Then the only way to kill them... He looks out through a window at the CLOCK TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++. is to kill you. A look of pure confidence fills Dracula's face.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: That is correct. A deranged look fills Van Helsing's face.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: So be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks back into the tower. Aleera lunges at her, but Frankenstein grabs her. Anna starts to head back to help Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN
dialogues.text: No! Go help Van Helsing. Frankenstein throws Aleera across the room, then looks at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKENSTEIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! Anna looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you. Frankenstein nods and turns back to Aleera, who flies acr the room and tackles him. Anna scrambles back out the win  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bolt of lightning suddenly rips a huge GAPING HOLE out the bridge near Carl, blocking him from continuing forwar It's a twenty-foot leap or a sixty-story drop. He looks b and sees Anna crawling out of the smashed window.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Anna! I need some help! Anna clings to the wind-whipped wall, trying not to get b into the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Now is not a good time, Carl!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dracula moves in on Van Helsing, Van Helsing looks out a window to the CLOCK-TOWER. The BI HAND slams forward. It is now exactly one minute to midni The clock CHIMES. Van Helsing's whole body suddenly CONVULSES. Insanity pours into his eyes. Dracula looks perplexed. Van Helsing GROANS:

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: One. Van Helsing TRANSFORMS into the biggest, sexiest, most ba assed Werewolf ever. Dracula looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: No .... This ... this is not right (furious) This can not be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks from the clock tower to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Hurry! Anna leaps out and grabs the same electrical wire that Frankenstein used. The wire HISSES and SPARKS as Anna is swung down across the castle. The CLOCK CHIMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula cautiously backs off as the huge Werewolf collect itself and moves towards him. For the first time in his l life, Dracula actually looks nervous, he plays for time.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You and I are part of the same grand game, Gabriel. But we need not find ourselves on opposite sides of the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock CHIMES. Carl steps up to the edge of the bridge he's going to throw Anna the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Three! Anna switches wires in mid-air as she rockets across the castle. Carl aims and throws the syringe. Anna grabs it! arcs up towards the Laboratory Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf LUNGES at Dracula. Dracula whirls around, becoming the Winged Beast, he flies up the wall, heading the open skylight. The Werewolf bounds after him, ripping way straight up the sheer rock, it leaps out and grabs th Winged Beast. Both creatures crash down into the equipmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock CHIMES as Anna arcs up towards the Laboratory Tower. And that's when Aleera swoops down and cuts the wi Anna is thrown off. She crashes onto a ledge of the tower

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dracula leaps up first and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: You're being used Gabriel. As was I. But I escaped, and so can you! The Werewolf springs at Dracula. Dracula becomes the Wing Beast and desperately uses his four razor sharp appendage claw at the Werewolf. The Werewolf howls in pain, then la out and rips away at the Beast. The Beast shrieks, then throws itself up into the rafters and becomes Dracula, hi arm is torn and limp. The clock CHIMES.  108.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know who you are. Who controls you. Join me! Join me and I'll cut the strings that play you! I'll give you your life back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna clambers up onto a ledge just as Aleera lands next t her. Anna starts backing up the precarious perch as Aleer closes in. WE PAN UP to the FULL MOON and see CLOUDS ABOU OBSCURE IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf looks insanely hungry as it closes in on Dracula, who is desperately backing away.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: Don't you understand!? Four hundred years ago we were friends. Partners! Brothers! The clock CHIMES. The Werewolf leaps at him. Dracula beco the Beast and desperately tries to flyaway, but he's too damaged. The Werewolf grabs him by the throat, about to k him, and that's when the Werewolf turns back into Van Helsing. Van Helsing quickly staggers back. Dracula looks at the roiling clouds obscuring the moon, then he looks a Van Helsing. That old confident glint fills Dracula's eye

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I mention that it was you who murdered me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock CHIMES. Anna backs up against a wall on the led trapped. Aleera steps in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: ALEERA
dialogues.text: Your blood shall make me even more beautiful. What do you think of that? A SILVER STAKE suddenly impales her through the chest. Al shrieks. Anna looks over at the bridge, to where Carl has crawled down between the girders, then she looks back at Aleera, who is staring at her in horror and starting to r  109.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I think if you're going to kill somebody, kill them, don't stand around talking about it. Aleera bursts into rot, the silver stake is flung into a right next to Carl's head. The clock CHIMES. Carl looks u the clock.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: How many is that? How many is that!? Anna is already racing up the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Eight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing desperately backs off through the FLAMING, SPARKING equipment as Dracula slowly moves in on him.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: All I wanted was life, Gabriel ... now I'll have to take yours. Dracula holds up his left hand, his ring finger has long been CUT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'll take my ring back as well. The clock CHIMES. Van Helsing backs up into a wall, trapp breathing hard, the two men stare at each other. Dracula' bicuspids distend into long fangs.

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, Gabriel, now I will give you back your life, your memory. And then through a window, Van Helsing sees the clouds ab to fully reveal the full moon. The clock CHIMES.

dialogues.speaker: VAN HELSING
dialogues.text: Some things are best left forgotten. Van Helsing becomes the Werewolf. He lunges, grabs Dracul and CHOMPS into his throat. Dracula CRIES OUT in agony.  110. Dracula starts shriveling and decaying and wasting away u there is nothing left but charred remains burning into th floor. The clock CHIMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the pygmy bats shriek in horror and then explode i black goo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna bursts into the room and races at the Werewolf's bac syringe in hand, ready to stab him. The clock CHIMES.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Twelve. The Werewolf spins around and sees Anna coming. He POUNCE FANGS and CLAWS. Anna SCREAMS. The Werewolf tackles Anna. They crash down onto a couch. Carl runs in and skids to a stop, the Werewolf's back is to him, but he can see that alive and on top of Anna.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Midnight. Carl is devastated. He lifts up the silver stake.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God forgive me. He runs forward and swings the stake down at the Werewolf back. At the last millisecond the Werewolf spins around a grabs Carl's wrist, stopping him short. Carl is terrified stares at the Werewolf. The Werewolf stares back, then tu slightly to reveal the SYRINGE sticking out of its chest, empty. The Werewolf lets go of Carl. Carl stumbles back. Werewolf rips the empty syringe out of its chest, throws away, then looks down at Anna. Her eyes are wide open.

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's dead. And then WE CUT TO one of the most iconographic SHOTS in whole movie: the FULL MOON shines in through an arched st window, which frames the Werewolf, who is crouched over o gorgeous heroine, sprawled dead across a broken couch. WE SLOWLY PUSH IN as the Werewolf tilts its head back and BAYS AT THE MOON, a long, mournful HOWL, it slowly TRANSF back into Van Helsing, CRYING OUT at the moon in anguish.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl READS from the Bible, tears on his cheeks. Van Helsi carrying a torch, steps up to a funeral pyre. He stares d at Anna, lying on the pyre, looking beautiful. WE CUT WID see that they ate on a bluff overlooking the SEA. EXT. SEA вЂ” DAWN A dark figure paddles a makeshift raft out to sea. It's Frankenstein. He looks back up to the bluff to see the flaming pyre IGNITE. Frankenstein doffs his hat in respec sighs heavily, then turns back around and continues paddl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glow from the flames flickers off Van Helsing's sad f as he stares down at the ground. Carl still reading. The SMOKE from the funeral pyre suddenly FORMS A PICTURE ANNA'S FACE. Tendrils of smoke waft out, like long smoky fingers they touch Van Helsing's chin and lift it up. Van Helsing sees her. Anna smiles. Then her face starts to fl up into the dawn sky along with the rest of the smoke. Van Helsing is shocked, he staggers forward, as if to fol Anna's face is suddenly surrounded by the vague faces of mother, her father, her brother Velkan, and many other welcoming family members. Her father gives her a hug. Her mother starts to comb her hair. Carl smiles as he steps up and puts his hand on Van Helsi shoulder. Anna gives Van Helsing one last look, her radiant eyes beaming with happiness, and then she and all of her famil start to ascend into the glowing dawn sky. Van Helsing stares upward, devastated. And then in one final glorious moment, Anna and her famil swoop up into the sky and blend with the fading stars. WE PUSH IN on Van Helsing's face as the look in his eyes changes, from devastated loss, to a gentle look of peace. can see that he is truly happy for Anna ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Helsing and Carl riding two black stallions across an endless golden wheat field, heading off into a new dawn. FADE OUT.
